0.title: Pune veterinary doctor defrauded of ₹35 lakh in chit fund scam
0.article_body: A veterinary doctor from Pune's Kalewadi was cheated of ₹35 lakh in chit fund fraud, police officials said on Wednesday. The doctor, Ashok Krushna Bhondwe, was advised to invest in the scheme by the accused upon being assured of monthly returns. Bhondwe then transferred ₹35 lakh to the accused's account, who cited market crash and didn't pay back any interest.

1.title: 5 people abduct hotel staffer, refuse to pay food bill in Pune; held
1.article_body: Five people were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly attacking and kidnapping a hotel staffer in Pune. As per police, the accused had dined at Hotel Ranmala before refusing to pay the entire food bill. They abducted the staffer when he asked for payment. The staffer has been rescued. One of the accused was also arrested in a murder case earlier.

2.title: Heatwave conditions spark wildfires in southern Europe
2.article_body: Europe battled a spate of wildfires on Wednesday as heatwave conditions linked to climate change sparked new blazes and impeded firefighting operations. Forest fires were reported from Portugal, Spain, France and Turkey - rendering to waste several thousand acres of forest land. In Portugal, about 120 people required medical attention and two sustained serious burns.

3.title: Free COVID-19 precaution dose PM Modi's gift to nation: JP Nadda
3.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda said that Centre's decision to provide free COVID-19 precaution doses to all adults was one of the gifts of PM Narendra Modi to the nation. The Union Government announced that from July 15 all adults will be given free precaution doses for 75 days. This drive is part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations.

4.title: 7-year-old tests positive for Zika virus in Maharashtra's Palghar
4.article_body: A 7-year-old girl tested positive for Zika virus in Maharashtra's Palghar district, the health department said. The girl is a resident of Ashramshala in Jhai, the department further added. Preventative and control measures along with surveillance, vector management, treatment and health education are being undertaken. The first case of Zika virus was reported in Pune in 2021.

5.title: 3 more people die of Japanese Encephalitis in Assam, death toll rises to 16
5.article_body: Three more people have died due to Japanese Encephalitis (JE) in Assam. The state reported 17 more cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total tally of cases to 121 since July 1, the National Health Mission said. With three new deaths, the death toll due to the disease in Assam has risen to 16.

6.title: UP sub-inspector suspended as video of him beating a man goes viral
6.article_body: A sub-inspector from Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district was suspended on Wednesday for allegedly assaulting a man and pointing his service pistol at him. This comes after a video of sub-inspector Arun Kumar Gautam beating the man inside a clinic went viral. The man had gone to the clinic for treatment after his motorcycle collided with the sub-inspector's bike on Tuesday.

7.title: 7-yr-old Thane boy cycling on terrace falls into creek; feared drowned
7.article_body: A seven-year-old boy was cycling on the open terrace of his chawl in Thane when he lost his balance and fell into a creek on Wednesday. Rescue team couldn't find Rishi Usva till late evening. It's feared that he drowned in the flooded waterbody. Usva, the son of a vegetable vendor, was reportedly riding a cycle for the first time.

8.title: SC to hear pleas against Karnataka HC order on hijab ban next week
8.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the petitions challenging the Karnataka High Court order on hijab ban next week. On March 15, the Karnataka High Court passed a judgement stating that wearing hijab was not an essential religious practice. Advocate Prashant Bhushan, appearing for the petitioners, mentioned the matter for urgent listing before the Chief Justice of India N V Ramana.

9.title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee serves pani puris in Darjeeling
9.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee made pani puris at a roadside stall in Darjeeling and served them to tourists. She visited a stall run by women from a Self Help Group (SHG) and showed her expertise in preparing the street food. Mamata was in Darjeeling to participate in the swearing-in ceremony of the new members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration.

10.title: Charred body found in a burnt car in Karnataka's Udupi district
10.article_body: A burnt car with a charred body was found in an isolated area at Henaberu in Byndoor taluk of Karnataka's Udupi district, police sources said. The police have not been able to identify the deceased as the body was charred beyond recognition and only skeletal remains were found. The frame of the car and the number plate were also charred.

11.title: Switzerland advises citizens against non-urgent travel to Sri Lanka
11.article_body: Switzerland's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday advised its citizens to avoid non-urgent travel to Sri Lanka. "The political situation is confused and tensions have increased. A deterioration of the situation must be expected," it added. This comes after Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country for the Maldives amid a severe economic crisis.

12.title: Russian President Putin to visit Iran next week
12.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will be in Iran next week, as part of the Astana format  - a trilateral meeting of Russia, Turkey and Iran. Putin's trip follows US President Joe Biden's ongoing visit to the Middle-East. Earlier, the US said Iran is preparing to arm Russia with several hundred drones capable of carrying weapons for use against Ukraine.

13.title: European Space Agency celebrates launch of Vega-C rocket
13.article_body: The European Space Agency celebrated the first flight of its Vega-C rocket on Wednesday. Vega-C is an upgraded module of the Vega rocket introduced in 2012, with the latest version capable of carrying heavier payloads while burning lesser fuel. The agency said Vega-C will be used to send Earth observation satellites and an uncrewed robotic laboratory.

14.title: CBI to probe alleged killing of BJP activist in WB after 2021 polls
14.article_body: The CBI has taken over the investigation into the alleged killing of BJP activist Prasenjit Das in Kolkata amid the post-poll violence in West Bengal in 2021. Das was found hanging outside his residence by his mother last year. The CBI has re-registered a case of abetment to suicide against nine people, including two staffers of Baguiati Police Station.

15.title: Women to be worst hit by cost-of-living crisis: WEF
15.article_body: The World Economic Forum on Wednesday said the global cost-of-living crisis caused by increases in fuel and food prices will hit women the hardest. The Geneva-based forum added that the estimated number of years required to attain gender parity has now decreased to 132 years from 136 years. It considered economic opportunity, education, health and political empowerment as defining factors.

16.title: Kohli's Under-15 days' roommate DB Ravi Teja meets him after 6 years in UK, shares pics
16.article_body: Virat Kohli's Under-15 days' roommate DB Ravi Teja took to Twitter to reveal he met Kohli after six years in the UK. Sharing pictures from their meeting, he wrote, "First thing he tells me is 'Chiru Kaise hai tu?'...I used to watch Chiranjeevi's songs on TV & he danced to them...From then on Chiru was nickname we gave each other."

17.title: India defeat Japan 3-1, finish 9th in women's hockey World Cup 2022
17.article_body: Navneet Kaur scored a brace as the Indian women's hockey team defeated Japan 3-1 to finish ninth in hockey World Cup 2022. Navneet scored two field goals in the 30th and the 45th minutes, while Deep Grace Ekka converted a penalty corner in 38th minute in the classification match. India had finished eighth in the women's hockey World Cup 2018.

18.title: Amber Heard is 'abso-f**king-lutely' a gold digger: Actor Mickey Rourke
18.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke has called Amber Heard a "gold digger" in an interview. Asked about Johnny Depp's trial, he said, "I was in a situation...where I was blamed for something I didn't do...I felt...bad for somebody trying to get chopped down by some gold digger." When asked if that's what he thought Amber was, he stated, "Abso-f**king-lutely."

19.title: Bengaluru park sign against 'anti-clockwise' walking goes viral
19.article_body: A public advisory at a Bengaluru park which asks citizens to not walk in the "anti-clockwise" direction has gone viral on social media. The notice reads, "No jogging, no walking, no anti-clockwise walking." The post attracted comments, with a user asking, "Is nagin dance allowed?", to which another said, "Only if you do it clockwise."

20.title: Villagers demand enhanced compensation for Jewar Airport land acquisition
20.article_body: The land acquisition for the Jewar International Airport in Uttar Pradesh has hit a roadblock with about 3,200 villagers demanding enhanced compensation and resettlement. Acknowledging the impasse, MLA of Jewar Dhirendra Singh said he will take up the issue with Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The Jewar Airport is expected to be one of the biggest in the world after completion.

21.title: Three arrested for murdering gutka trader in Bengaluru: Reports
21.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested three people, including a couple, for allegedly murdering a gutka trader from Bihar. The body was found in a drain on July 5, wrapped in plastic, media reports quoted officials as saying. The deceased's wife is among the accused and there is a financial payment and adultery angle in the killing, officials said.

22.title: EU allows transit of sanctioned Russian goods to Kaliningrad via rail
22.article_body: European Union (EU) said on Wednesday that sanctioned Russian goods can transit through bloc's territory by rail to Russia's exclave Kaliningrad, adding that such trains should be checked. This comes amid tensions between Russia and EU member state Lithuania over transit ban of such goods amid Ukraine war. The only rail line connecting Kaliningrad to mainland Russia passes via Lithuania.

23.title: Lost 2021 polls because of manipulators in our party: AIADMK's EPS
23.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami said that the party lost 2021 state elections because of manipulators in AIADMK itself. "CM Stalin thinks he can knock our party with the help of traitors in AIADMK. But it won't happen, we'll form government again," Palaniswami said. Palaniswami's comment comes after he took control of the party as its interim General Secretary.

24.title: 3 killed, 3 injured as truck falls into gorge in Himachal's Lahaul
24.article_body: Three people were killed and three others sustained injuries after the truck in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul-Spiti district on Wednesday, an official said. The injured were taken to Keylong civil hospital, State Disaster Management Director Sudesh Mokhta said. Indian Army jawans, BRO jawans and the police helped to pull out the bodies.

25.title: Owner of South African bar where 21 teens died arrested: Police
25.article_body: The owner of the bar in South Africa's Eastern Cape province where 21 teenagers died last month has been arrested, the police said on Wednesday. Notably, the forensic teams are yet to reveal their conclusions on how the teens died. Two employees of the bar have also been arrested, the police added.

26.title: 120 SL-bound planes land at Kerala airports amid crisis, Scindia praises
26.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia showered praise on Trivandrum and Kochi airports as 120 Sri Lanka-bound airplanes landed there on Wednesday. "The airports have gone beyond their call of duty...The gesture will go a long way in furthering ties with our neighbour," Scindia said in a tweet. Sri Lanka declared a state of emergency today amid ongoing anti-government protests.

27.title: I'm not gay but Bruce Lee was the only guy I wanted to kiss: Ram Gopal Varma
27.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma recently revealed that he wanted to kiss the legendary martial artist and actor Bruce Lee. Varma said he watched 'Enter The Dragon' as a young boy, and right from that point he has been in awe of his work. "I'm not gay, but he (Bruce Lee) was the only guy I wanted to kiss," he added.

28.title: West Bengal witnessing extreme appeasement: Governor Dhankhar
28.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday criticised the state government and said the state is witnessing extreme appeasement. "Our state has serious problems of governance," Dhankhar said. "I appeal to civil society and intelligentsia to speak about this serious problem of governance," he said, adding that this appeasement will destroy democracy.

29.title: 60,000 arrested in Bihar for violating liquor ban this year: Police
29.article_body: Nearly 60,000 people were arrested across Bihar between January and June this year for flouting the state's ban on liquor, the police said on Wednesday. Of these, nearly 10% of the arrests took place in Patna district. More than 16 lakh litres of liquor was seized and over 7,000 vehicles carrying alcohol were impounded, according to official data.

30.title: CRPF seizes over 600 IEDs, 495 detonators from Naxals in Bihar
30.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) recovered arms and ammunition from Naxals in Bihar's Gaya last week, the force said on Wednesday. CoBRA commandos of the CRPF recovered over 600 improvised explosive devices (IED) and 495 detonators during the anti-Naxal operation, an official said. One AK series of rifle and 250 rounds of ammunition were also recovered.

31.title: Healthcare platform MediBuddy acquires healthtech startup Clinix
31.article_body: Digital healthcare platform MediBuddy acquired healthtech startup Clinix, which offers online consultation with doctors in rural areas. Clinix caters to the healthcare needs of the rural population across 20 tier II and tier III cities and helps them overcome several difficulties to avail quality healthcare. In June 2020, MediBuddy had merged with online doctor consultation provider DocsApp.

32.title: Hyenas kill 13 goats in Chhattisgarh's Durg district
32.article_body: A pack of hyenas killed 13 goats and injured eight others during an attack in a village in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, an official said on Wednesday. Notably, it is the first such attack reported in the area, according to Divisional Forest Officer Shashi Kumar. Villagers have been advised to remain alert, Kumar said.

33.title: 24 children fall sick after eating midday meals at school in UP
33.article_body: At least 24 children were hospitalised in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday after having midday meals at school. Basic Shiksha Adhikari (BSA) Shubhum Shukla said that a lizard was found in the meals consumed by the students. Parents of the students reached the hospital and demanded strict action against the school headmaster and two cooks for their negligence.

34.title: Congress sees politics in National Emblem: K'taka CM Bommai
34.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress over the National Emblem controversy and said the party sees politics in it. "Its fierceness shows our way of thinking," Bommai said. This comes after Congress criticised the BJP over the National Emblem cast atop the new Parliament building and accused the Centre of changing the nature and character of Ashokan lions.

35.title: BJP turning Amarnath Yatra into a 'political issue': Mehbooba Mufti
35.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti accused the Centre of turning Amarnath Yatra into a "political issue". "The environment does not permit more than 5,000 pilgrims every day, but they sent thousands of people there. The result was that the cloudburst took place," Mufti said. She claimed the administration was hiding the actual number of deaths in Friday's cloudburst incident.

36.title: Indian-origin Sunak wins most votes in 1st round of voting to succeed Johnson as UK PM
36.article_body: The UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won the most votes in the first round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as leader of the Conservative Party and UK Prime Minister. Sunak scored 88 votes, ahead of Penny Mordaunt (67 votes) and Truss Liz (50 votes), reported Reuters. Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi and former cabinet minister Jeremy Hunt were eliminated.

37.title: BJP only national party today, others reduced to families: Nadda
37.article_body: BJP is the only national party today, while others have been reduced to families and individuals, said BJP president JP Nadda on Tuesday. While addressing the party's training camp in Rajasthan, Nadda expressed confidence that BJP will form the government in the state with a thumping majority in the Assembly polls next year.

38.title: 5 people, including 2 aged over 70, die of cholera in Amravati
38.article_body: Five people, including two women, have died due to cholera in Maharashtra's Amravati district since July 7, 2022, when the disease broke out due to heavy rainfall. Three of the deceased were aged between 24 and 40, while two were aged over 70. A total of 181 people in the district were recently diagnosed with the water-borne disease.

39.title: 'Send him back to Sri Lanka': Gotabaya faces protests in Maldives
39.article_body: Sri Lankan expatriates in Maldives staged a protest against President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday, demanding that Rajapaksa be sent back to Sri Lanka. "Dear Maldivian friends, please urge your government not to safeguard criminals," one of the protest banners read. Rajapaksa fled to Maldives earlier today with his wife amid raging protests in Sri Lanka over the ongoing economic crisis.

40.title: Many Himachal BJP leaders suffocated within their party: Congress
40.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress President Pratibha Singh on Wednesday said many BJP leaders in the state are eager to join the Congress as they feel "suffocated" due to infighting in their party. Her statement comes a day after former Himachal Pradesh BJP President Khimi Ram joined the Congress. Singh also said that people are "fed up" with BJP's policies and decisions.

41.title: 2 pictures of Jupiter taken by world's most powerful telescope leaked
41.article_body: A NASA team leaked two pictures of Jupiter taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST). The images were included in a NASA commissioning document to show that the telescope's NIRCam can track moving targets. These pictures weren't a part of the first batch of full-colour images taken by JWST, that was released on Tuesday.

42.title: CA Final results to be out by July 16
42.article_body: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) will declare results of CA Final, held in May this year, on either July 15 evening or July 16 morning. The marks will be uploaded on the official website – icai.org. Meanwhile, Chartered Accountants Foundation examinations, which were postponed at Silchar examination center, have been rescheduled between July 14 and July 16.

43.title: Geeta Kapur shares post for Farah, says 'Thank you for holding my hand'
43.article_body: Choreographer Geeta Kapur took to Instagram on Wednesday and thanked mentor Farah Khan Kunder on the occasion of Guru Purnima. Sharing a picture with her, Geeta wrote, "Thank you for always holding my hand...thank you for never letting me fall...thank you for sharing your craft..love you forever @farahkhankunder there will never be another for me HAPPY GURU POORNIMA MAMMA."

44.title: Flash floods kill 39, including 9 children, in Afghanistan: UN
44.article_body: The United Nations (UN) said on Wednesday said that flash floods have killed at least 39 people, including nine children, in Afghanistan. The heavy rains have damaged or destroyed around 2,900 houses, he added. The rains have caused land to slide, exposing unexploded ordnance from four decades of war and conflict, it further said.

45.title: Who are the highest-ranked Indian batters across formats in latest rankings?
45.article_body: As per the latest rankings released by ICC, world number five Test batter Rishabh Pant is the top-ranked Indian batter in Test cricket, followed by Rohit Sharma, who is overall ranked ninth. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli, who's world number three ODI batter, is the top-ranked Indian batter in ODI cricket. Meanwhile, Suryakumar Yadav is the top-ranked Indian batter in T20I cricket.

46.title: MP govt to organise 'Youth Mahapanchayat' in Bhopal on July 23, 24
46.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government will organise a 'Youth Mahapanchayat' in Bhopal on July 23 and 24. According to an official statement, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the objective of the gathering is to provide a platform to youth wherein they can suggest solutions to various social, economic and political challenges in the state. Chouhan urged youth to participate in large numbers.

47.title: SC to hear plea to declare Ram Sethu a heritage monument on July 26
47.article_body: The Supreme Court on July 26 will hear BJP leader Subramanian Swamy's plea seeking a direction to the Union government to declare 'Ram Sethu' a national heritage monument. Swamy submitted he had won the first round of litigation where the Centre accepted the Ram Sethu's existence. Ram Sethu is a chain of limestone shoals between Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka.

48.title: Don't follow orders of Sri Lanka's acting Prez: Ex-Army chief to military
48.article_body: Sri Lanka's ex-Army chief Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka on Wednesday urged the country's armed forces to not follow the orders of acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Fonseka, who is a Member of Parliament, claimed that directives issued by Wickremesinghe are "against the Constitution". Fonseka also urged the armed forces to refrain from using their weapons against innocent and unarmed citizens.

49.title: B Praak remembers his 2nd son whom he lost during birth, says 'You're my angel'
49.article_body: Singer B Praak has penned a note remembering his second son whom he lost during birth and called him his angel. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "I never got to hear your cry. I never saw your beautiful eyes...I never saw your innocent smile...But you're my angel son and you will forever be missed until we meet again...Mera Beta Fazza."

50.title: EV startup Ather Energy posts 411.9% revenue growth for FY22
50.article_body: Electric Vehicle startup Ather Energy said that they generated ₹408.5 crore in revenue for FY22, up 411.9% compared to ₹79.8 crore in the previous fiscal. With the cost of EV parts and raw materials rising, the startup's loss also widened to ₹344.1 crore from ₹233.3 crore in FY21. Last year, Ather expanded to 34 stores across 28 cities.

51.title: Content monetisation platform ConsCent raises ₹13.26 crore
51.article_body: Content monetisation platform ConsCent has raised ₹13.26 crore in a bridge round, the company announced. The round was led by Inflection Point Ventures and saw participation from Varanium Capital, RiSo Capital, SucSEED Indovation Fund, among others and some angels. The startup provides technology to India Today Group, Outlook India Group, The New Indian Express, among others.

52.title: Centre must win hearts of Kashmiris: Farooq Abdullah
52.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Wednesday said the Centre must win the hearts of the people in Kashmir to end terrorism. He condemned the killing of a police official in Srinagar on Tuesday, seeking “handsome compensation” for the victim's kin. Abdullah said the government must open talks with Pakistan to bring peace to the Valley.

53.title: Want to thank all men who broke my heart & stomped over it: Pooja Bhatt
53.article_body: Speaking about her past relationships, actress Pooja Bhatt said, "God bless all the men that I have been with because I think I have taken something from each one of them." "I especially want to thank the people who broke my heart and stomped all over it...Because that is what reintroduces you to yourself," she added.

54.title: Kanpur rioters paid ₹1,000 to pelt stones, ₹5,000 to hurl bombs: SIT
54.article_body: A probe by Special Investigation Team (SIT) revealed that rioters were allegedly paid ₹500-₹1,000 to pelt stones and ₹5,000 to hurl petrol bombs in Kanpur last month. Miscreants who agreed to participate in arson were assured free legal assistance, the SIT claimed. The miscreants were allegedly trained for eight-nine days. The riots occurred after Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

55.title: Restore order: Sri Lankan Acting Prez to military amid protests
55.article_body: Sri Lankan Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe instructed the country's armed forces and police to "restore order" as thousands of anti-government protesters stormed into his office on Wednesday. Protesters were seen breaching military defences to enter the premier's office and raise national flags there, witnesses said. Wickremesinghe declared a state of emergency in Sri Lanka earlier today.

56.title: Former US NSA John Bolton admits to having planned coups in foreign countries
56.article_body: Ex-US National Security Adviser (NSA) John Bolton said on Tuesday that he had helped plan attempted coups in foreign countries. Bolton made the remarks on live TV while discussing the congressional hearing into the January 6, 2021 attack on the US Capitol. On being asked to get into specifics, Bolton mentioned Venezuela, adding, "It turned out not to be successful."

57.title: Why is the July 13 full Moon called the Buck Moon?
57.article_body: According to The Old Farmer's Almanac, the July 13 full Moon is called the Buck Moon because the antlers of bucks or male deer normally grow around this time. "Early summer is normally when the new antlers of buck deer push out of their foreheads in coatings of velvety fur," said NASA. It's also referred to as the Thunder Moon.

58.title: Biden lands in Israel as part of his 1st trip to Middle East as Prez
58.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday arrived in Israel as part of his first official tour of the Middle East since taking office. The US will deepen Israel's integration into the Middle East, Biden said after landing at Ben Gurion Airport. Biden, who first visited the region in 1973, noted that this is his 10th visit to Israel.

59.title: Cong should apologise: Minister on 'evil philosophy' remark on Murmu
59.article_body: Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Wednesday criticised Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, stating that Congress should apologise for it. "Tribes weren't recognised by Congress even [as it was] in power for...long time," he added. Kumar had said that Murmu represents "evil philosophy" and shouldn't be made "symbol of tribals".

60.title: Court allows Aryan Khan to get back his passport, cancels bail bond
60.article_body: A Special NDPS court on Wednesday allowed Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan to get back his passport which was in its custody as per the bail condition in the Cordelia cruise drugs case. The court passed an order after NCB gave no objection to the same. The court noted that bail bond stands cancelled and his surety stands discharged.

61.title: US inflation hits new 4-decade high of 9.1% in June
61.article_body: The consumer price index (CPI) in the US jumped in June 2022 at its fastest year-over-year pace since the end of 1981, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 9.1% in June 2022 from the same month a year ago. Excluding food and energy, the core CPI rose 5.9%, compared with the 5.7% estimate.

62.title: What Deepika Padukone did in Gehraiyaan, I did 15 years ago: Mallika
62.article_body: Mallika Sherawat compared films 'Murder' and 'Gehraiyaan' and said she has never been appreciated for her acting and people always focus on her body. "Such hue and cry was created when I did 'Murder'. People said all kinds of things about the kiss and...bikini," she added. "What Deepika Padukone did in 'Gehraiyaan', I did that 15 years ago," Mallika said.

63.title: Will ensure CAA isn't implemented if elected Prez: Yashwant Sinha
63.article_body: Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Wednesday said that if he is elected, he will ensure that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) is not implemented. "Earlier, the government gave the excuse of COVID-19, but even now they have not been able to implement it because it is an Act foolishly drafted in a hurry," he said.

64.title: I expected Alia to know who the President of India is: Karan Johar
64.article_body: Karan Johar revealed that he didn't disclose the questions from the 'Koffee With Karan' quiz during which Alia Bhatt named Prithviraj Chauhan as the President of India. "I...didn't want them to screw up and...they still did. I didn't give them the quiz, thinking they knew the basics and then, of course, we...know about the big Alia Bhatt goofup," he added.

65.title: Video shows Shivpuri ADM calling democracy a mistake amid MP polls
65.article_body: A video showing Shivpuri Additional Collector Umesh Shukla calling voting and democracy mistakes has gone viral. Shukla made the remark when he was approached by voters who were facing difficulties because of expired ballot paper amid elections in Madhya Pradesh. He said, "Democracy is [India's] biggest mistake...What did you get by voting? Several corrupt leaders have been born by voting."

66.title: There is a fascist threat to democracy in Sri Lanka: Acting Prez
66.article_body: In his first televised address since being appointed as Sri Lanka's acting President on Wednesday, Ranil Wickremesinghe said that there is a fascist threat to democracy in the country. "Those who are in my office want to stop me from discharging my responsibilities...We can't let them tear up our Constitution," he added. Anti-government protesters had stormed Wickremesinghe's office.

67.title: BJP's Malviya sending doctored video: Cong's Ajoy over his Murmu remark
67.article_body: Responding to his statement over NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday said that BJP's IT cell in-charge Amit Malviya has doctored the video, which is being misrepresented. "Droupadi Murmu is a decent person, but she represents an evil philosophy of India. We shouldn't make her a symbol of tribals," Kumar had earlier said.

68.title: Loan agents harass Andhra woman with morphed pics, she kills self
68.article_body: A married woman in her early 20s hanged herself to death at her residence in Andhra Pradesh on Monday. Before her death, she said in a self-recorded video that she's committing suicide due to harassment by online loan agents. She claimed they threatened to send her morphed nude pictures to her relatives if she didn't repay a loan of ₹20,000.

69.title: Solomon Islands PM meets Aus, NZ leaders amid China pact worries
69.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian and New Zealand counterparts, Anthony Albanese and Jacinda Ardern, in separate bilateral meetings for the first time since Solomon Islands signed a security pact with China. Notably, Australia and New Zealand had voiced concerns over possible Chinese military presence in Solomon Islands due to the pact. The pact was signed in April.

70.title: Hyd man trying to place warning sign board run over by speeding car
70.article_body: A man in Hyderabad was run over by a speeding car while he was trying to place a signboard to warn motorists of a hole in the middle of a busy street. The incident took place on Tuesday when the deceased walked across the middle of the road to put back the warning sign board after it had fallen off.

71.title: I never invited or met him: Hamid Ansari on Pak journalist's claim of spying on India
71.article_body: Former Vice President Hamid Ansari, reacting to Pakistani journalist Nusrat Mirza's claim that he was invited to India by Ansari, called it "a litany of falsehood." "It's a...known...fact that invitation to foreign dignitaries...are on...advice of the government...I never invited him or met him," said Ansari. Mirza claimed he passed on information collected during his India visits to ISI.

72.title: 2 commit burglaries in Mumbai, spend money on family trips; held
72.article_body: A 42-year-old man and his brother-in-law were arrested for burglaries in Mumbai, who used to spend money on sightseeing with their family members after committing crimes, police said on Wednesday. "The duo used to do a recce of commercial establishments and flats before targeting them," a Mumbai Police official said. Police recovered cash and several mobile phones from their possession.

73.title: Euro falls below $1 for the first time in nearly 20 years
73.article_body: The euro dropped below parity against the US dollar on Wednesday for the first time in almost 20 years. Euro was trading at around $0.998 at 12:45 pm GMT, down 0.4% in 24 hours, marking its lowest level since December 2002, Reuters reported. The euro has lost more than 10% so far this year.

74.title: Man blessed with male child after 3 daughters kills 19-yr-old boy as human sacrifice in MP
74.article_body: A 32-year-old man named Ramlal allegedly killed a 19-year-old boy named Divyansh Kol to offer him to goddess as a human sacrifice after being blessed with a male child in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district. Ramlal had three daughters and he wanted a male child. As per police, Ramlal hacked Divyansh to death and left his body in a temple.

75.title: Wasim Jaffer's 'Alexa, please play Bumrah' tweet goes viral, Alexa reacts
75.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah's performance in the first ODI against England, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "'Alexa, please play Jasprit Bumrah', 'Sorry, Jasprit Bumrah is unplayable'," after which the tweet went viral. The official Twitter handle of the Amazon's cloud-based voice service reacted to Jaffer's tweet, writing, "Now playing 'U Can't Touch This' in honour of the Boom Boom Bumrah."

76.title: Ukraine will not cede territory to reach peace deal, says Foreign Min
76.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday ruled out ceding territory to Russia as part of any peace deal. "The objective of...this war...is to liberate our territories, restore our territorial integrity, and full sovereignty in the east and south of Ukraine," Kuleba said. Currently, there are no peace talks being held between Russia and Ukraine, he added.

77.title: Assam minister, others targeted in 'gift card scam'; FIR filed
77.article_body: Assam minister Bimal Borah has lodged an FIR with the police after unidentified fraudsters created fake WhatsApp accounts of him and other senior officials to cheat people. "Messages were being sent [on my behalf] to...[people], asking them to transfer money by purchasing some gift vouchers," Borah said. "I've asked the police to investigate and trace the criminals," he added.

78.title: Bihar DSP arrested for involvement in BPSC exam paper leak racket
78.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) from Bihar has been arrested in connection with the leak of Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations in May. DSP Ranjit Kumar Razak allegedly used to get people appointed in state government services through BPSC exams for money. "He was in touch with...key players in this racket," police said.

79.title: Minor boy engaged in child labour rescued in Hyderabad
79.article_body: The She Teams of Rachakonda Police along with the Muskan team rescued a minor boy, a native of  Tamil Nadu, who was engaged in child labour, the police said on Wednesday. The company's owner and the boy's parents were counselled about child labour, the police added. The minor boy worked in the Industrial Development Area in Nacharam, they said.

80.title: Family refuses to take body of CRPF jawan who shot himself in Raj
80.article_body: CRPF jawan Naresh Jat's relatives have refused to accept his body after he shot himself in Rajasthan on Monday. They've demanded that first his colleagues be arrested for allegedly instigating him to commit suicide. They also want a government job for Naresh's six-year-old daughter on attaining majority, lifelong pension to his wife and a guard of honour at his funeral.

81.title: Day of expressing gratitude to Gurus: PM Modi on Guru Purnima
81.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended his greetings on Guru Purnima to the nation, calling it a day of expressing gratitude to all exemplary Gurus who have inspired us and mentored us. "May the blessings of our Gurus take India to newer heights," PM Modi tweeted. He also extended his wishes on the occasion of 'Ashadha Purnima'.

82.title: Agritech startup nurture.farm partners with SBI General Insurance
82.article_body: Agritech startup nurture.farm will partner with SBI General Insurance and Future Generali India Insurance Company to provide 1.9 million farmers with insurance solutions, the company said. Having received a licence from the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority, the startup can now provide farmers with insurance solutions at lower costs. The firm aims to help 2 million farmers in FY23.

83.title: T'gana govt extends holidays for schools, colleges amid heavy rains
83.article_body: The Telangana government has announced the extension of holidays for schools and colleges until July 16 amid incessant rains in the state. Educational institutions will reopen on July 18, a government circular stated. This comes after the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy to very heavy rains for the next three days across the state.

84.title: I used to pass on information collected during my visits to India to ISI: Pak journalist
84.article_body: Nusrat Mirza, a Pakistani columnist who has visited India many times during 2007 to 2010, claimed that he used to pass on information collected during his visits to Pakistan's ISI. He said he received various privileges from the foreign affairs department of Pakistan during his visits to India. Mirza further claimed that former Vice President Hamid Ansari had invited him.

85.title: 46-yr-old shopkeeper assaulted in Delhi, family suspect role of owner
85.article_body: A 46-year-old shopkeeper was critically injured after he was allegedly assaulted by some people in Delhi's Kinari Bazaar area, police said. According to the statement given by the victim's father, four to five people carrying iron rods had enquired about Deepak (shopkeeper), alleging that he had teased a girl. Deepak's father said he suspected the involvement of the shop owner.

86.title: Hyderabad Mayor instructs GHMC officials to stay alert amid rains
86.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal conducted a review meeting and instructed zonal commissioners of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) to be vigilant amid incessant rains in the city. She directed officials to keep field staff on alert and attend to complaints received from stranded citizens. She appealed to citizens to beware of electric poles and avoid taking shelter under trees.

87.title: NIA raids 9 premises in connection with Udaipur murder case
87.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday conducted raids at nine locations linked to the accused and suspects in the Udaipur murder case. An NIA spokesperson said the agency seized mobile phones, laptop, SIM cards and other incriminating materials during the raids. Earlier, two of the accused said they killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal to avenge an insult to Islam.

88.title: We were neighbours in Goa: Janhvi Kapoor on how she bonded with Sara
88.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor spoke about how she and Sara Ali Khan became friends during their appearance on 'Koffee With Karan'. "We were neighbours in Goa...One day we started talking. We ended up talking till...morning," she said. Janhvi recalled she was impressed with Sara during their trip to Disneyland. "She broke every line. I kept thinking, 'she's so cool'," Janhvi added.

89.title: WB Governor Dhankhar behaves in a communal manner: TMC MLA Ali
89.article_body: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Wednesday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of being communal and alleged that he behaves in a communal manner. Ali had previously sparked controversy for alleging that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "Prime Minister Modi will also resign and flee," he had said.

90.title: Pune schools to remain shut on July 14 in view of heavy rain
90.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that all schools under its jurisdiction will remain shut on Thursday in view of heavy rain prediction in the region. However, the teaching and non-teaching staff of all civic schools will have to report to their respective schools to take part in disaster management-related work of the PMC.

91.title: Singapore viewed as an attractive target for terror attacks: Govt
91.article_body: The Singapore government on Wednesday said that the city-state is viewed as an "attractive target" for terror attacks by both foreign terror outfits and lone radicalised actors. The Internal Security Department (ISD) in its annual report said that terrorists may make their way to new conflict zones after the pandemic. The government has asked citizens to remain on high alert.

92.title: Man arrested for raising peacocks at his residence in Karnataka; adult bird seized
92.article_body: A man identified as Manju Nayak has been arrested on charges of raising peacocks at his residence in Kamegowdanahalli village in Karnataka's Mysuru district. The peacock is India’s national bird and is protected under the Indian Wildlife Act 1972. During a raid at Manju's residence by the Mobile Vigilance Squad of the Karnataka Forest Department, an adult peacock was seized.

93.title: Haryana to build science city on 50 acres of land in Gurugram
93.article_body: The Haryana government will set up a science city on around 50 acres of land in Gurugram, an official statement said. The project will be completed with the help of the Centre, it added. Once it's set up, students from the state and other parts of the country would get an opportunity to practically learn scientific principles, an official said.

94.title: Man gets 20 yrs rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting 2 girls in Guj
94.article_body: A special court in Gujarat's Rajkot district sentenced a man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting two minor girls. The girls, aged three and five years, were playing alone near their houses when the accused lured and assaulted them, Public Prosecutor Ghanshyam Dobariya said. The incident was reported in Rajkot's Gondal taluka on May 20 this year.

95.title: I'm filing a complaint against Team India, jokes Mahindra over quick win vs England
95.article_body: After a total of 44 overs were played in first ODI between England and India, with India chasing down the target in 18.4 overs, Anand Mahindra jokingly tweeted, "I'm filing a complaint against Team India for such a brutally dominant victory in such a short time." He added, "Because by the time I switched on the TV...the match was done."

96.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, kills 82-year-old woman owner in Lucknow
96.article_body: An 82-year-old woman was mauled to death by her pet dog at her house in Lucknow, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Sushila Tripathi, a retired school teacher, was on the roof of her house on Tuesday morning when her pitbull attacked her. The domestic help found her lying in a pool of blood and informed her son.

97.title: Greek news outlet targeted in arson attack
97.article_body: The office of Greek news outlet Real News and Real FM was set on fire in Athens on Wednesday in a suspected arson attack, the media firm said. No deaths were reported, but several people with respiratory issues were taken to hospital. The news outlet linked the attack to imprisoned anarchist Yannis Michailidis.

98.title: I'm the same girl who visits temple & wears bikinis at the beach: Sara
98.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan opened up about how she's 'constantly evolving' in life. Speaking about herself, Sara said, "The girl going to a temple is the same girl wearing bikinis at the beach is the same girl who hates living away from her mother for 45 days while shooting." "She'll keep surprising you because she's still surprising herself," Sara added.

99.title: Russian, Ukrainian officials to discuss export of grain stocks
99.article_body: Russian and Ukrainian military officials will meet in Istanbul, Turkey on Wednesday to discuss the export of Ukrainian grain which is held up due to the ongoing war between the two countries. The United Nations organised the meeting to mitigate a potential grain shortage globally. Turkey has offered a safe route through the Black Sea to move the stocks.

100.title: 4 pilgrims from UP feared drowned in Ganga river in Uttarakhand
100.article_body: Four pilgrims from Uttar Pradesh were feared drowned after their vehicle fell into the Ganga river in Tehri district of Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning. A search operation was launched, however, the victims haven't been found yet, police said. The four were reportedly returning from Kedarnath when their car fell into the river, the relatives of one of the victims said.

101.title: Liverpool's Nunez trolled for missing open goal-scoring chance vs Man Utd
101.article_body: Liverpool's Darwin Nunez has been trolled on social media for missing an open goal-scoring opportunity against Manchester United in their pre-season game. In the 88th minute, Nunez received the ball on rebound after Mohamed Salah's effort but failed to score, kicking the ball over the bar. "Time to bring him out of my fantasy team," wrote a user on Twitter.

102.title: There isn't a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing: Sanya
102.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra, who will reportedly feature in SRK-starrer 'Jawan', said, "I am from Delhi...but I don't feel safe there...I don't think there is a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing." "I feel more safe in Mumbai," added Sanya. "I have been through so many weird situations when I was in college [in Delhi]," she had stated.

103.title: England need to think hard about pitches they want to use for next ODIs: Jaffer
103.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said England need to think hard about the pitches they want to use for the next two ODIs against India. Jaffer added that England's plan to leave grass on the wickets proved costly for hosts as "India have three quality pacers". England were dismissed for 110 runs in the first ODI on Tuesday.

104.title: Bengaluru-based startup Hyperface raises $9 mn in seed funding
104.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit-card-as-a-service platform, Hyperface has raised $9 million in a seed funding round. The round led by 3one4 Capital and Flipkart Ventures, saw participation from existing investors Better Capital and Global Founders Capital and new investors Groww and Rebalance Angel Community. It was founded by ex-banker Aishwarya Jaishankar and Ramanathan RV, former Co-founder of Juspay.

105.title: FM interested in Uranus, Pluto rather than tackling inflation: Congress
105.article_body: A day after the government released its inflation data, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Wednesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for retweeting pictures from NASA's Webb Telescope. "She has an interest in Pluto, Jupiter and Uranus. Unfortunately, our Finance Minister is showing the way to Pluto, Uranus...and is unable to show...way forward to our economy," Vallabh said.

106.title: Bengaluru Police arrest two-wheeler thief; recover 25 vehicles
106.article_body: As many as 25 vehicles were recovered after Bengaluru Police arrested a notorious two-wheeler thief on Wednesday. Vinayak Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police (North Bengaluru), shared a photo of the 25 recovered vehicles on Twitter, which include 21 motorcycles and four scooters. The vehicles were found to be registered in different states, including Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka etc.

107.title: Over 1,700 hectares burnt as wildfires rage in southwestern France
107.article_body: Around 600 firefighters supported by six water-bomber planes are battling to contain two wildfires in southwestern France, which have already burnt over 1,700 hectares of land and prompted the evacuation of thousands of tourists. "Important human and material resources are being deployed to master the fires," authorities said. France is currently suffering from a second heatwave of the year.

108.title: Succession beats West Wing, bags most Emmy acting nominations in 2022
108.article_body: The nominations for the 74th Emmy Awards were announced on Tuesday, July 12. 'Succession' received a leading 25 Emmy nominations. It also received the most acting nominations thus beating 'The West Wing', which held the previous record. 'Ted Lasso' topped the comedy and 'The White Lotus' earned the top spot in the limited series categories with 20 nominations each.

109.title: Pune's poor cut consumption of dal, meat during COVID lockdown: Study
109.article_body: As many as 194 households surveyed within Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits by FUSE, a transdisciplinary research project, revealed that people altered their food habits during COVID-19 lockdown. The most-affected households, which were among the low-income group, consumed less meat and dal during this period, study found. "People’s purchasing power was significantly affected," study read.

110.title: 23-yr-old garage owner runs over man with client's BMW in Delhi
110.article_body: A 23-year-old garage owner was arrested for running over a man in Delhi's Greater Kailash area with a client's BMW he had taken for repair, police said on Wednesday. DCP (south) Benita Jaiker said that during interrogation, the accused said he hit a person around 2:30 am on July 10 but could not stop the car because of high speed.

111.title: Quite scary to think where the game is headed: Ashwin on 'Bazball'
111.article_body: Talking about England's 'Bazball' approach, Ravichandran Ashwin said that as bowler, it is quite scary to think where the game is headed. "I think we need to be careful about this brand of cricket being the way forward," Ashwin added. "I definitely think the ball and the pitches have a role to play in how England are playing," he remarked.

112.title: 45 hand guns worth over ₹22 lakh seized from Indian couple at Delhi airport, pic surfaces
112.article_body: The Customs Department arrested an Indian couple that arrived from Vietnam and seized 45 hand guns worth more than ₹22 lakh from their possession. "They admitted their previous indulgence in smuggling 25 pieces of guns having a value of over ₹12 lakh," an official stated. As per reports, the couple belongs to Haryana's Gurugram.

113.title: Everyone thought I was a snob, felt like a misfit: Parambrata Chatterjee
113.article_body: Actor Parambrata Chatterjee, who featured in Vidya Balan-starrer 'Kahaani', said, "People have been...critical of me because all of them thought I was a snob since I came from a university...I felt like a misfit." "I don't know if being a son...of a famous actor...helps, but that isn't me...I feel...I should have grown up in a more regular environment," he added.

114.title: Ukraine-returned medical students protest in Odisha, say 'our futures jeopardised'
114.article_body: Ukraine-returned medical students staged a protest in Odisha's Bhubaneswar demanding admission to Indian medical universities. "All we ask is to be admitted to Indian universities, be it government or private. Our futures have been jeopardised. We cannot go back to a war-torn country," one of the protesting students said. The protestors carried placards demanding justice.

115.title: Ajoy's remark shows what Congress thinks of tribals: BJP's Babulal Marandi
115.article_body: Former CM of Jharkhand and BJP leader Babulal Marandi criticised Congress' Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu and said that his statement shows what Congress thinks about tribals and women. "Tribal people got nothing during Congress rule," he said. Congress is having trouble because for the first time a tribal woman is nominated, he added.

116.title: AI platform Attentive raises $5 mn from Sequoia India's Surge Fund
116.article_body: Artificial Intelligence-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform Attentive Inc has raised $5 million from Sequoia India's Surge Fund and InfoEdge Ventures. Attentive has a SaaS-based sales automation platform for the outdoor service industry and serves the landscaping, snow removal, paving, and pest control businesses. The startup was founded by Rishabjit Singh, Sarthak Vijay, and Shiva Dhawan.

117.title: Family kidnaps 25-yr-old woman for getting married against their will in Ludhiana
117.article_body: A newlywed 25-year-old woman was allegedly kidnapped by her family from Ludhiana’s Maskeen Nagar, for getting married against their will. The woman’s husband alleged that her family members turned up at their house on Monday, thrashed him and took her with them against her will. Sub-inspector, Harpal Singh, said that an FIR has been lodged against the accused.

118.title: Do not fall ill or get into accidents: Sri Lanka doctors amid economic crisis
118.article_body: Doctors in Sri Lanka are advising people to not fall ill or get into accidents amid the country's worst economic crisis. The nation doesn't have money to pay for imports like fuel and food, and medicines for cancer, rabies and STDs are running out. Sri Lanka Medical Association President said doctors might be forced to choose which patients get treatment.

119.title: Want to keep them under wraps: Neha on why she doesn't reveal her kids' faces
119.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia spoke about breaking her rule of hiding her kids' faces. "I am still in a phase where I want to keep them under wraps and protect them. It was just one special moment on stage, which was really important...for me," she said. "But I will go back to my notorious ways of hiding their faces," she added.

120.title: Original lion different: CPI MP demands removal of distorted emblem
120.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam on Wednesday criticised the Centre and said that the original Ashoka Pillar lion differs from the one atop the new Parliament building and demanded its removal. "This lion suits the ideology and politics of RSS and BJP and PM Narendra Modi," he said. This lion is frightening everybody, he added.

121.title: 300 families in flood-hit Maha village unable to cook for 4 days
121.article_body: Around 300 families have reportedly been unable to cook their meals for the last four days after heavy rains caused flooding in Maharashtra's Kurunda village. The sarpanch of the village said that flood water has entered over 1,100 houses, damaging the food grains of the residents. A revenue official said assistance of ₹5,000 each will be given to affected people.

122.title: Gurugram court sentences man to 10 yrs in jail for firing at police
122.article_body: A local court in Gurugram has sentenced a Nuh resident to 10 years in jail for firing at a police team in 2020. The man had fired at the police team following a vehicle chase over a missing number plate. Head constable Ashok Kumar had filed an FIR at Bilaspur police station after the incident.

123.title: Will fulfil promise of making Punjab a drug-free state: AAP leader
123.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab unit's Chief Spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said the Bhagwant Mann-led government will fulfil its promise of making Punjab a drug-free state. "Earlier, only drug addicts...were arrested," he said, adding that directions have been issued to seize the property of proclaimed offenders. He further accused previous governments of "playing politics over the issue".

124.title: KCR to give positions to people who fought during T'gana movement: TRS leader
124.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha said people who fought during Telangana movement will be awarded some position by CM K Chandrashekar Rao "when the time comes". "A very good position and identity have been given to Rajeev Sagar…Every brother, sister and people who fought during the Telangana movement with Rajeev will also be given positions by CM KCR," she added.

125.title: Difficult to manage workload, need to take care of body: Bumrah
125.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said "it's difficult to manage workload" across formats and that's why priority should be given to the format in which the team has to play a global event. "If it's a World Test Championship final year, the emphasis is on Test cricket," explained Bumrah. He added, "You...need to take care of your body."

126.title: Mumbai realtor cheated of ₹26 lakh, case filed against 4 persons
126.article_body: A 46-year-old realtor, Pravin Wagh, was cheated of ₹26 lakh under the pretext of facilitating a work tender of Mumbai airport's parking lot, for which the police have booked four persons. The complainant alleged that the four members cheated him after gaining his confidence. Police said a case was registered under sections of criminal breach of trust and cheating.

127.title: Fake currency notes with ₹15 lakh face value seized in Odisha, 2 held
127.article_body: Police on Wednesday said the Special Task Force (STF) seized fake currency notes with a face value of over ₹15 lakh in Odisha's Sambalpur and arrested two inter-state criminals. The STF also seized two laptops and one colour printer from the accused. Recently, the STF busted a similar racket in Bargarh district and seized notes with ₹14 lakh face value.

128.title: 52-year-old man found dead in his apartment in Thane's Mumbra
128.article_body: Police said that a 52-year-old man, Abdul Haque Zakir Ali Sayyed, was found dead in his apartment in Thane's Mumbra area. Some unidentified persons slit the victim's wrists and throat and placed the bloodstained knife in his hand to make it appear like a suicide, a police official said. The victim's son informed the police about the death.

129.title: Brought disgrace to Bihar: Tejashwi faces ridicule for fumbling before PM
129.article_body: Responding to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's faltering speech at an event attended by PM Narendra Modi, BJP spokesperson Arvind Kumar Singh on Wednesday said that Yadav brought disgrace to Bihar. "On the occasion of Guru Purnima, we salute the teachers of Tejashwi Yadav, who does not have enough skills to read out from a text," he said.

130.title: Mann launches new RC service, Akali Dal says it was started in 2011
130.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday announced new e-Registration Certificates (e-RCs) service for new vehicles through automobile dealers. People will get the delivery of a smart registration certificate at their doorsteps, Mann added. Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal said that the service was started by their government in 2011 and is in place since then.

131.title: Hyderabad's infrastructure much better than Bengaluru's: T'gana IT Minister
131.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao said that he has no competition with Bengaluru but he believes that Hyderabad's infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru's. Listing out things he tells his investors about the city, Rao said, "We tell them that Hyderabad is the city where the North meets the South. Biology marries technology...Our infrastructure is much better than Bengaluru."

132.title: Chinese scientists develop robot fish that eats microplastics
132.article_body: Chinese scientists have developed a robot fish that eats microplastics and believe it may one day help to clean up world's polluted oceans. The 1.3-cm-long black robot fish is irradiated by a light that helps it in motion and can be controlled using it. When eaten by other fish, the robot fish, made up of polyurethane, can be easily digested.

133.title: Delhi Metro ridership now 76% of pre-COVID-19 figures: DMRC MD
133.article_body: Delhi Metro has recovered around 76% of pre-COVID-19 ridership and hopes to achieve 100% ridership in the coming months, DMRC MD Vikas Kumar said. He added that the ridership has increased ever since schools and colleges reopened last week. Delhi Metro's Yellow Line has a daily ridership of 28%, while the ridership of Blue Line stands at 22%, reports said.

134.title: My surname has opened doors for me: Kamal Haasan's daughter Shruti
134.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's daughter and actress Shruti Haasan said she admits the fact that her surname has opened doors for her. "When I came, there was a buzz around the surname, but the truth of the matter is staying was really hard and challenging for me," added Shruti. "I was pretty much written off after my first film," she stated.

135.title: This Indian team should win all ODI, T20I World Cups: Vaughan
135.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said the current Indian team has the skills and should win all the global white-ball tournaments. "India have just got to get on a roll in white-ball cricket...This group of white-ball experts that have been built on the back of IPL should be pushing all the way in all conditions [across the] world," he stated.

136.title: Those 18+ to receive free booster COVID-19 dose from July 15 till next 75 days: Govt
136.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said, "India is celebrating 75 years of Independence." "On the occasion of Azadi ka Amrit Kaal, it has been decided that from July 15 till the next 75 days, citizens above 18 years of age will be given booster COVID-19 dose free of cost," he further said.

137.title: Athiya reacts to reports of wedding with KL Rahul in 3 months, says 'Hope I'm invited'
137.article_body: After a report suggested that the wedding of actress Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul will be held in the next three months, the former responded on Instagram Stories. "I hope I'm invited to this wedding that's taking place in 3 months, lol," she wrote. Her father, actor Suniel Shetty had previously said, "No, nothing has been planned yet."

138.title: 2 Sri Lankan state broadcasters go off air as protests intensify
138.article_body: Amid anti-government protests, two Sri Lankan national TV networks, Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC) and Independent Television Network (ITN Ltd), have suspended telecasts. SLRC went off air after two protesters said during a live interview on the channel that the SLRC should only telecast programmes of 'jana aragalaya' (mass struggle). Sri Lanka declared a state of emergency on Wednesday.

139.title: MP man threatens people to return money after losing election; booked
139.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh's Devran village has been booked for allegedly threatening people to return the money he had distributed to secure votes in the panchayat elections after his loss. A video showing the accused, Raju Dayma, asking people to return his money has reportedly surfaced online. He had allegedly recovered around ₹4 lakh from people following his defeat.

140.title: 22-year-old woman loses over ₹1 lakh to online job fraud in Pune
140.article_body: A 22-year-old woman lost over ₹1 lakh due to online job fraud in Pune, police said. An online fraudster cheated the woman on the pretext of offering her a job with a bank, police added. The accused had allegedly asked the victim to transfer the money for purposes like "registration, deposit, laptop, HR commission, GST charges" for getting the job.

141.title: Bumrah shares pic with ball after recording his best ODI figures, says 'Keeping it close'
141.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with the match ball after recording his best-ever ODI bowling figures. "Keeping this close," Bumrah wrote alongside the picture. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 7.2-3-19-6 in the first ODI against England. These are the best ODI bowling figures by an Indian outside Asia.

142.title: Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology: Eknath Shinde on Guru Purnima
142.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde paid floral tribute to Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray on the occasion of Guru Purnima and said, "It is only due to his blessings that I stand before you all as the CM today." Sharing a Twitter post, he wrote, "Won't betray Balasaheb's ideology. That fire will not be extinguished...there is no thought without Hindutva."

143.title: US embassy in Colombo suspends consular services after SL Prez escapes
143.article_body: The US embassy in Colombo has said it was cancelling consular services for Wednesday afternoon and for Thursday as a precautionary measure. This comes after Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country on a military plane amid mass protests over the economic crisis. The Sri Lankan government has imposed a state of emergency across the country.

144.title: Was obsessed with Hrithik, screamed on seeing him at a party: Ananya
144.article_body: Talking about Hrithik Roshan, actress Ananya Panday said, "I was obsessed with Hrithik...I saw him at some birthday party and...started screaming, 'Hrithik! Hrithik!'...My parents just reacted and said, 'This is not our child'." "My mom tried to leave me and go away," Ananya had earlier shared about the incident. "I think everyone is in love with Hrithik," she had stated.

145.title: China claims it 'drove away' US warship from its waters
145.article_body: China on Wednesday said that its military had "driven away" a US warship from its territorial waters in South China Sea. The incident took place near the disputed Paracel Islands, which are also claimed by Vietnam and Taiwan. The US Navy said that the USS Benfold "asserted navigational rights and freedoms in the South China Sea...consistent with international law".

146.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out, 1 rating point difference between Kohli, Rohit
146.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with fourth-ranked Rohit Sharma moving within a solitary rating point of teammate and third-placed Virat Kohli. Rohit has accumulated 802 rating points, while Kohli is on 803 rating points. Pakistan's Babar Azam remains on top of the rankings with 892 rating points, followed by his compatriot Imam-ul-Haq (815 rating points).

147.title: Prostitution racket busted in 2 spas in Bengaluru; 7 arrested, 8 rescued
147.article_body: Bengaluru's Central Crime Branch (CCB) on Monday busted a prostitution racket after women officers raided a beauty salon. The officials acted on a tip-off and raided two spas within the Puttenahalli Police Station limits, where they discovered employees involved in the prostitution racket. A total of seven people, three suspects and four customers, were arrested and eight women were rescued.

148.title: Protestors enter Sri Lanka Prime Minister's office
148.article_body: After a state of emergency was declared in Sri Lanka, protestors entered the country's Prime Minister's office. The Speaker of the country's Parliament earlier said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will submit his resignation today, adding that a new President will be elected on July 20. Gotabaya fled the country along with his wife.

149.title: 10-yr-old domestic help tortured to death in Pak for eating fruits
149.article_body: A 10-year-old boy working as domestic help in Pakistan's Lahore was allegedly tortured to death by his employers for eating fruits from the refrigerator without permission. The deceased's six-year-old brother, also employed in the same house, was severely injured, police said, adding that the accused "even used a knife to inflict injuries to the children". Five people have been arrested.

150.title: Minor girl's Instagram account hacked in Pune, police begin probe
150.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police have registered a case of online stalking after a 15-year-old girl's Instagram account was allegedly hacked and obscene content, along with her number and photos, were added to it. An FIR was filed against an unknown person based on complaint of the girl's father. "We've launched a probe into...various digital leads available...[to track]...the suspect," police said.

151.title: I still get thin-shamed, people ask me to eat more: Erica Fernandes
151.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes revealed she has been struggling to break away from industry norms and has been skinny-shamed by trolls for many years now. "We're living in a world where people either fat shame you, or thin shame you. We, as individuals, need to stay strong and face," she added. "I lost work because I couldn't gain weight," Erica said.

152.title: Cong must apologise: BJP on Ajoy Kumar’s ‘evil philosophy’ remark on Murmu
152.article_body: Following Congress leader Ajoy Kumar’s "evil philosophy" remark on NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, BJP's spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla demanded that Congress must apologise for the statement. "The Congress party must explain or else they must apologise for the statement that they have made insulting not just Droupadi Murmuji but the entire Adivasi community," he added.

153.title: India's condition will soon be like Sri Lanka, Afghanistan: TMC MP
153.article_body: India's condition will soon be like Sri Lanka and Afghanistan under the BJP-led Central government, TMC's National General Secretary and MP Abhishek Banerjee said. "The way fuel and LPG prices are rising, soon the situation will be like Sri Lanka and Afghanistan," he added. "The price hike people are facing is the prize for voting for BJP," Banerjee stated.

154.title: UP Police forms SIT to probe cases against Alt News' Mohammed Zubair
154.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has formed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe six cases registered against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in Sitapur, Lakhimpur Kheri, Hathras, Ghaziabad and Muzaffarnagar. Zubair was remanded to 14-day judicial custody by a Lakhimpur Kheri court in UP on Monday. A police complaint was filed alleging Zubair circulated false news to disturb communal harmony.

155.title: Indians will create Sri Lanka, Afghanistan-like situation against BJP: TMC MP
155.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee said BJP will face Sri Lanka and Afghanistan-like situation by people because of the hike in fuel prices in country. "People won’t have food to survive. What happened in Sri Lanka and Afghanistan, people of India will create similar situation against BJP I believe," Banerjee added. Petrol and diesel prices are rising steadily, he stated.

156.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav jumps 44 spots in latest rankings for T20I batters
156.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who slammed his maiden hundred in T20I cricket against England on July 10, has jumped 44 spots to reach the fifth spot in the latest rankings for T20I batters. Suryakumar has accumulated 732 rating points, which is his career-best rating so far. Suryakumar is the only Indian batter in top 10.

157.title: IMDb releases list of top 10 Indian films in 2022 so far
157.article_body: IMDb on Wednesday released the list of most popular Indian films of 2022 so far. The top 10 films so far, in order of their IMDb rating, are- 'Vikram' (8.6), 'KGF: Chapter 2' (8.5), 'The Kashmir Files' (8.3), 'Hridayam' (8.1), 'RRR' (8.0), 'A Thursday' (7.8), 'Jhund' (7.4), 'Runway 34' (7.1), 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' (7.0) and 'Samrat Prithviraj' (7.0).

158.title: England thought short ball was Rohit's weakness, his counter was fantastic: Kaif
158.article_body: Praising him for his unbeaten 76-run innings in the first ODI against England, Mohammad Kaif said the Team India captain Rohit Sharma's counterattack against short balls was "fantastic". "Rohit got dismissed [against short balls] in between quite a few times and England thought it's his weakness," added Kaif. Rohit's five sixes in the first ODI came against the short balls.

159.title: U'khand bans swords, tridents & other harmful objects in Kanwar Yatra
159.article_body: Uttarakhand administration has barred pilgrims from carrying swords, tridents and other harmful objects during the Kanwar Yatra, scheduled to begin tomorrow. "There will be a ban on bringing swords, tridents and sticks in the Kanwar Yatra," a police official said. "All the station and outpost in-charges have been instructed to seize them at the district borders," he added.

160.title: Writer Khaled Hosseini's daughter comes out as transgender, he pens note for her
160.article_body: 'The Kite Runner' writer Khaled Hosseini's 21-year-old daughter Haris has come out as transgender. He shared her pictures and wrote, "I've known about Haris' journey since last year...I've never been prouder of her." He added, "I know this process was painful for her...She is sober to the cruelty trans people are subjected to daily. But she is strong and undaunted."

161.title: Bumrah becomes world number one ODI bowler after career-best performance
161.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has become the world number one ODI bowler in the latest rankings released by ICC. The 28-year-old, who recorded his best bowling figures in ODIs by taking six wickets for 19 runs against England on Tuesday, jumped five places to reach the top spot. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult has dropped to the second position.

162.title: Scindia's new bungalow in Bhopal flooded with drain water amid rain, video surfaces
162.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia's new government bungalow in Bhopal's Shymala Hills getting flooded with drain water amid continuous rain. In the video, a worker can be seen draining out the water using a wiper. Scindia had shifted to the bungalow in May this year after its renovation.

163.title: Owner of car with 'Papa' number plate in Uttarakhand fined; police shares pic
163.article_body: The owner of a car has been fined by the Uttarakhand Police over its number plate that read "Papa". Police shared before and after pictures of the number plate on Twitter and said that it received the complaint through a tweet. Twitter users praised the police for its action against the car owner.

164.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai student on picnic in Lonavala drowns in waterfall
164.article_body: A 20-year-old BCom student from Mumbai reportedly drowned in a waterfall near Bhushi dam on Monday. The deceased, Sahil Saroj, had come for a picnic in Lonavala with a group of 250 students. "Sahil and his friend went to the...waterfall...He waded into the gushing waters...and failed to come out. He fell from the cliff from where waterfall starts," police said.

165.title: Maha CM asks officials to keep emergency services on alert amid rains
165.article_body: Speaking about the monsoon rains situation in Maharashtra, newly appointed Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said that he has directed the district officials to keep emergency services on alert. He also asked the officials to ensure that no untoward incident occurs and assistance reaches the affected people on time. Several districts of Maharashtra are on red and orange alert.

166.title: Bumrah's wife Sanjana trolls England batters by visiting 'Crispy Duck' stall
166.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah's wife Sanjana Ganesan visited a stall called 'Crispy Duck' at The Oval to troll England after four of their batters got out for ducks in the first ODI. She said, "We've come to...stall that not a lot of English batters would like to come to...We want to see how good the duck is off the field."

167.title: I really don't know: Bumrah on status of Kohli's groin strain
167.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, on being asked about the status of Virat Kohli's injury after the first ODI against England, said he doesn't know the status of the injury. "Because I didn't play the last game (3rd T20I). Hopefully, he recovers, but I really don't know," stated Bumrah. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a "mild groin strain".

168.title: Nobody's done what we're doing with ancient Indian inspiration: Ayan
168.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, who's directed the upcoming film 'Brahmastra', said, "No one's...done what we are doing with ancient Indian inspiration in the modern world ever." Talking about the character of Ranbir Kapoor, Ayan stated, "He's a miracle because he's an astra himself - Agni astra...He is named after the God who is the...all powerful and my greatest inspiration, Shiva."

169.title: Dengue cases surge in West Bengal, highest in last 4 yrs
169.article_body: Dengue cases are rising in West Bengal as the state recorded a four-year high in first 26 weeks of this year. While the state registered 1,037 dengue cases in first 26 weeks of 2019, that number dropped to 619 and 273 in 2020 and 2021, respectively. However, it has shot up to 1,751 in first 26 weeks of 2022.

170.title: 21-yr-old woman jumps off moving SUV to escape molestation bid in Lucknow
170.article_body: A 21-year-old woman reportedly jumped off a moving SUV to escape a molestation bid in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. She was rushed to a hospital after sustaining injuries in the incident. "The accused had offered a lift to the girl...After driving some distance, he started making advances towards her and...tried to molest her," police said. He was arrested on Tuesday.

171.title: 5 killed in 24 hours in Maharashtra amid heavy rains; death toll rises to 89
171.article_body: At least five persons were killed in 24 hours amid heavy rains and flood-like situations across various districts in Maharashtra. The total death toll has risen to 89. One person died in Raigad due to the collapse of a structure and another died in Palghar in a landslide. Notably, three persons lost their lives in Nagpur due to flash floods.

172.title: Woman's body found near posh residential complex in Greater Noida
172.article_body: The body of an unidentified woman was found near a posh residential apartment complex in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. "The woman is around 35 years old and we are trying to identify her," police added. "There is a deep cut on her left wrist due to which she seems to have lost a lot of blood," police stated.

173.title: Raj govt to study recruitment exam models of Tamil Nadu, Kerala: Gehlot
173.article_body: The Rajasthan government will study recruitment examination models of Tamil Nadu and Kerala for the smooth conduct of such exams in the state, CM Ashok Gehlot said on Tuesday. A high-level team will visit both states to get detailed information, he added. Notably, the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam was cancelled in May following a paper leak.

174.title: You get such wickets very rarely: Shami on The Oval ODI vs England
174.article_body: India pacer Mohammad Shami said pacers are always longing to bowl on wickets like the one they got in the first ODI against England at The Oval on Tuesday. "You get such wickets very rarely...it is a different feeling that the ball is going to do something now," he added. Shami picked three wickets, conceding 31 runs in the match.

175.title: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe appointed acting President
