175.article_body: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has been appointed as the acting President of the country. This comes after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on a military jet amid mass protests over the economic crisis. The country's air force confirmed the 73-year-old flew to the Maldives with his wife and two security officials.

176.title: SC refuses to pass interim order staying demolitions across states
176.article_body: Supreme Court refused to pass an interim order staying demolitions across states. It cannot pass an omnibus order preventing authorities from taking action, the court added. "Rule of law has to be followed...But can we pass an omnibus order?" SC stated. It was hearing pleas over demolitions of properties of alleged accused in cases of violence in various states.

177.title: Congress has to do a lot of introspection: Digambar Kamat
177.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said Congress has to do a lot of introspection as the party is losing so many polls and leaders are leaving. "I worked for the party with sincerity," Kamat added. His statement came after Congress accused Michael Lobo and Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with BJP to engineer a split in the party’s legislative wing.

178.title: 80% ready to pay premium for environmentally-safe products: Public poll
178.article_body: 83% of the 1.76 lakh people surveyed across India said that they support the ban on single-use plastic, according to a poll conducted on Public, India's largest location-based social network. Although 62.8% believe the ban might cause some inconvenience to their day-to-day lives, about 80% said they are willing to switch to expensive, environmentally safe products to protect the environment.

179.title: Chris didn't eat meat before kiss in 'Thor: Love...' as I'm vegan: Natalie
179.article_body: Talking about her kissing scene with Chris Hemsworth in the film 'Thor: Love and Thunder', actress Natalie Portman said, "The day we had a kiss scene he didn't eat meat that morning because I'm vegan." "He eats meat like every half [an] hour," added Natalie. "I didn't even know Chris could go without eating meat," stated their co-star Tessa Thompson.

180.title: Bengaluru's St Joseph's College upgraded to a university
180.article_body: St Joseph's College (Autonomous) in Karnataka's Bengaluru has been upgraded to St Joseph's University, the university's management announced on Tuesday. The university is expected to be fully operational for academic year 2022-23. Notably, the process to confer the university status began in 2013 when the Ministry of Education launched the Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA) scheme.

181.title: Rupee hits new lifetime low of 79.67 per US dollar
181.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a new record low of 79.67 for a third straight session on Wednesday. In the previous session, the rupee had collapsed to close at 79.60 against the dollar. "There is a general risk-off sentiment. Until flows come back, we will see the dollar being bid against currencies like ours," a senior trader told Reuters.

182.title: We recreated Partition so beautifully, it really moves: 'Ms...' actor
182.article_body: Discussing the Partition in 1947 being recreated in 'Ms Marvel', the show's actor Mohan Kapur said, "The scenes are shot so beautifully and it really moves. Wow!" "I don’t know how many people...know about (the Partition)...That was our genocide," added Mohan. 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy had earlier said there were close to 1,000 extras on set in the scene.

183.title: DRI detects customs duty evasion of ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India
183.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has detected customs duty evasion of nearly ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India. Searches were conducted by DRI at office of Oppo India and residences of its key management employees. This led to the recovery of incriminating evidence indicating wilful mis-declaration in the description of certain items imported by Oppo India.

184.title: I know what it feels like, it's not nice: Morgan on England's 10-wicket loss
184.article_body: Reacting to England's 10-wicket defeat in the first ODI against India, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said Jos Buttler, the current English skipper, will have to take this as an opportunity to "reiterate a strong message about where they are going and what they're doing". Morgan added, "I know what this feels like. It's not nice...but [this] is time to lead."

185.title: Delhi HC allows Vivo to operate bank accounts if it furnishes bank guarantee of ₹950 cr
185.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed Chinese smartphone manufacturer Vivo to operate its bank accounts if it furnishes a bank guarantee of ₹950 crore. The court has also directed Vivo to maintain ₹250 crore in its accounts. Vivo India on Friday approached the court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by ED in connection with a money laundering case.

186.title: Man attacks policemen with shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka; arrested
186.article_body: A 39-year-old man was arrested for attacking two policemen with a shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka area on Tuesday. The accused was chasing another person with the blade to allegedly attack him. When the policemen caught him, the accused reportedly assaulted them. One of them suffered injuries on his head while the other suffered injuries on his hand, police said.

187.title: Droupadi Murmu represents very evil philosophy of India: Congress leader
187.article_body: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi". Following Kumar’s statement, BJP’s spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has insulted Murmu. "Yashwant Sinha is also a good candidate," Kumar added. "[PM] Modi-led government is fooling people," he stated.

188.title: Muslims using most contraceptives: Owaisi on UP CM’s 'population imbalance' remark
188.article_body: Following UP CM Yogi Adityanath’s "population imbalance" remark, AIMIM’s Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims are the ones using most contraceptives. "The total fertility rate which was 2.6 in 2016 is now 2.3. The country’s demographic dividend is the best among all countries," Owaisi added. "Their own Health Minister said no law is needed in country for population control," Owaisi stated.

189.title: Water level of Navi Mumbai's Ransai Dam reaches 112 ft, to overflow anytime
189.article_body: The water level of Ransai Dam located in Navi Mumbai's Uran area has reached 112.5 feet after continuous heavy rainfall in Maharashtra. As per report, the water level in the dam can anytime cross its maximum level of 116.5 feet and it will start overflowing. The Ransai Dam supplies water to more than one lakh people in 37 gram panchayats.

190.title: Central schemes have become scams in West Bengal: Smriti Irani
190.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the central schemes have become "scams" in West Bengal. "People have asked me to inform the administration to get them the central schemes as they are deprived of it," Irani added. She further said that she has spoken with the district administration and informed them about the "distress" of the people.

191.title: BMC staffer arrested in Mumbai for unnatural sex with man, causing him burns
191.article_body: A BMC employee was arrested for reportedly having unnatural sex with a 33-year-old man in Mumbai. The complainant said the accused was upset as he had demanded ₹6,000 from him. On July 6, after paying the money, the accused allegedly beat up the complainant and had unnatural sex with him, causing burn injuries to his private parts.

192.title: Which Indian places have been featured in TIME's 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022'?
192.article_body: TIME magazine has published a list of 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022' featuring "50 extraordinary destinations to explore" which includes India's Kerala and Ahmedabad. Calling Kerala the ecotourism hot spot, TIME said it is one of India's most beautiful states. The magazine said India's first UNESCO World Heritage City Ahmedabad is a mecca for cultural tourism and higher learning.

193.title: Pic of Elon Musk's business card from 1995 goes viral
193.article_body: A picture of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's business card from 1995 has gone viral on social media. The picture was shared by a Twitter handle named DogeDesigner. Responding to the picture of the card, which described Musk as Chairman of the Board, Chief Technology Officer and Co-founder of Zip2, Musk tweeted, "Ancient times."

194.title: COVID cases may increase five-fold: S Korea as cases hit 2-month high
194.article_body: Daily COVID-19 infections in South Korea on Wednesday jumped above 40,000 for the first time in two months, with the government warning of a potential five-fold surge in infections. Wednesday's figure of 40,266 represents an 8% jump over the previous day. "Daily infections could soar to...2,00,000 between mid-August and late September," PM Han Duck-soo told a government COVID-19 response meeting.

195.title: Wish to buy my films, watch myself as I'm very scared of judgement: Ranbir
195.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he wishes to buy all his films and watch them himself as he is "very scared" of judgement. "My last film 'Sanju', which came out four years ago, was a big hit. But still, people are saying that 'Shamshera' is my comeback film," added Ranbir. "So I do not understand what is this comeback film," he stated.

196.title: South films are remade in Hindi with cynical attitude: Producer Siddharth
196.article_body: Producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, who produced Aamir Khan-starrer 'Dangal', said, "South films are often remade in Hindi with a 'cynical attitude' because they worked in the past." "Unless the filmmakers...share the conviction of their South counterparts, they will not work," added Siddharth. "There has been no concentrated and strategic effort [by Bollywood] to cross state boundaries," he stated.

197.title: CNG, PNG prices hiked by ₹4 and ₹3 in Mumbai; 4th hike in 2022
197.article_body: Mahanagar Gas Limited has increased the prices of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Piped Natural Gas (PNG) prices in and around Mumbai by ₹4 and ₹3 respectively. CNG will now cost ₹80 per kilogram whereas PNG will cost ₹48.50 per Standard Cubic Metre (SCM). Notably, this is the fourth hike in the prices of natural gas in 2022.

198.title: Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoo flooded amid heavy rainfall
198.article_body: The Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park was flooded after heavy rainfall caused water in the Mir Alam Tank to overflow and enter the premises, Zoo officials said on Tuesday. Following the inundation, authorities declared the Safari Park closed to the public. However, the remainder of the Zoo will remain available to visitors from 8.30 am to 4.30 pm.

199.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency after President escapes to Maldives
199.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a state of emergency after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's escape to Maldives, the Prime Minister's office said. Thousands of protesters took to the streets of Sri Lanka's capital Colombo, demanding Rajapaksa's immediate resignation. Police fired tear gas to scatter protesters near Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe's office.

200.title: 4 killed as under-construction railway underpass collapses in J'khand
200.article_body: Four workers died after an under-construction railway underpass collapsed in Jharkhand's Dhanbad district on Tuesday night. According to officials, the labourers were working at the underpass between Pradhankanta and Sindri rail section. The portion caved in after a goods train crossed from a nearby track following which Railway and administrative officials rushed to the spot, officials added.

201.title: Dozens dead, thousands trapped without food as gangs battle in Haiti
201.article_body: Gun battles between rival gangs in the Haitian town of Cite Soleil have left thousands trapped without access to water, food or medical care, international aid group Doctors Without Borders said. Dozens of people have reportedly died in four days of gang battles. Cite Soleil, which lies on the outskirts of Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince, has a population of around 2,50,000.

202.title: Rhea, Sushant's flatmate Siddharth abetted the actor's extreme drug addiction: NCB
202.article_body: The NCB in its draft charge against 35 accused booked in the alleged drugs case filed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death said they entered a criminal conspiracy for distribution of drugs in Bollywood. Drugs were procured for Sushant by his flatmate Siddharth Pithani, Rhea Chakraborty and others who "aided and abetted" the actor to "extreme drug addiction", it added.

203.title: Genetically engineered pig hearts successfully transplanted into 2 dead people in US
203.article_body: A team at NYU Langone Health successfully transplanted two genetically engineered pig hearts into recently deceased humans with an aim to provide an alternative supply of organs for people with life-threatening heart disease amid shortages. The surgeries were performed over several hours and heart function was monitored for three days. No signs of early rejection were observed in either organ.

204.title: India is mother of all democracies: PM Modi in Bihar
204.article_body: Addressing an event in Bihar, PM Narendra Modi said that India is not just the largest democracy but it is also the "mother of all democracies". The PM also stated that the nation was "on its way to becoming a mature democracy" which was evident from "better attendance of lawmakers inside Parliament and state assemblies" and "discarding of obsolete laws".

205.title: 1 dead, 2 seriously injured in landslide in Vasai in Maharashtra's Palghar
205.article_body: At least one person died and two others were seriously injured in a landslide incident in the Vasai area of Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rains, the District Collector said. At least two persons have been rescued so far and three are still feared trapped. Local firemen rescued a woman and her daughter from their house, officials said.

206.title: If Kohli doesn't play the next game, then it would be more than a niggle: Ojha
206.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said if Virat Kohli doesn't play in the second ODI against England, then his injury could be more than a "mild groin strain". He stated that Kohli should be fit if he's suffering from a niggle. However, according to a report, Kohli is yet to recover and is unlikely to play in the second ODI.

207.title: We support tribals: Aaditya Thackeray on Shiv Sena supporting Murmu
207.article_body: Soon after ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray announced that Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls, Aaditya Thackeray said his party has decided to do so as Murmu is a tribal woman. "Today we've different political views but Droupadi Murmu is a tribal woman and we support tribals. That's why we will vote in favour of Murmu," he added.

208.title: LGBTQ members allege harassment by police at Pune event
208.article_body: The organisers of a private LGBTQ event held in Pune on July 9 have complained of harassment by the police. Writing to the Police Commissioner, they alleged that police locked around 150 members of their community inside the event venue without a warrant. "They...proceeded to use homophobic and derogatory statements," the founder of Mist LGBTQ Foundation told The Indian Express.

209.title: Rishi Kapoor & I argued, fought with each other: Karan on Agneepath
209.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Agneepath' which also featured late actor Rishi Kapoor, said, "[Rishi and I] would argue [and] fight...[over] the character arc." Karan added that they threw challenges at each other. "[Rishi] was...very flamboyant, loud...and...confrontational," he had earlier stated. Karan has directed Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera'.

210.title: 5 held in UP's Prayagraj for anti-Modi poster, T'gana man likely involved
210.article_body: The Prayagraj Police arrested five people in connection with an anti-Modi poster that was put up in the city. The police named a man hailing from Telangana as the prime accused in the matter. The accused have been booked under IPC Section 153B (hurting religious sentiments) and Section 505 (2) (statements creating and promoting enmity, hatred, or ill-will between classes).

211.title: 9 years on, the bond is still strong with Rohit Sharma: Shikhar Dhawan
211.article_body: After India openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma remained unbeaten to chase down England's 111-run target in their first ODI on Tuesday, Dhawan tweeted a picture of him and Rohit and wrote, "Nine years on, the bond is still strong Rohit." In the match, the duo became the fourth opening pair in ODI cricket to complete 5,000 runs in partnership.

212.title: Bradley Cooper is dating Hillary Clinton's former top aide Huma Abedin: Report
212.article_body: Bradley Cooper is dating Huma Abedin, the former top aide to Hillary Clinton and former wife of politician Anthony Weiner, according to Page Six. They were reportedly introduced by Vogue editor Anna Wintour, who is close to both Cooper and Abedin. The couple arrived together at the Met Gala event, however, they parted ways for the red carpet, reports claimed.

213.title: US First Lady apologises after saying Latinos unique as 'breakfast tacos'
213.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden has apologised for saying Latinos are as unique as "breakfast tacos". "The First Lady apologises that her words conveyed anything but pure admiration and love for...Latino community," her spokesperson said. Condemning Biden's comments, National Association of Hispanic Journalists had said, "We're not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos...shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype."

214.title: Anand Mahindra shares edited pic showing 'future of UK PM's residence'; it goes viral
214.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited picture showing the "future of UK PM's residence". "The future of 10 Downing Street? The famed British humour is now laced with Desi humour," Mahindra wrote. Mahindra shared the picture as Rishi Sunak, who has Indian roots, is one of the contenders for UK Prime Minister's post.

215.title: 47-yr-old woman found dead in lodge in Mumbai, boyfriend absconding
215.article_body: A 47-year-old woman was found dead in a lodge near Aksa Beach in Mumbai's Malad on Tuesday evening, an official said. The man, reportedly her boyfriend, is absconding, he added. The two had checked into the lodge on Monday night and began fighting soon after, he further said. "On Tuesday morning, the man left the place," the official stated.

216.title: TMC insulted Goddess Kali, now disrespecting National Emblem: Irani
216.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday reacted to TMC's criticism of the National Emblem atop the new Parliament building. "It is not unexpected from the party and its leaders who insult Goddess Kali to insult the National Emblem," Irani said. "Those leaders who...either disregarded or discarded the Constitution over the years, are expected to oppose the National Emblem," she added.

217.title: Religious conversion leads to separatism: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
217.article_body: Religious conversion should not be done as it separates individuals from their roots, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Tuesday. "Religious conversion leads to separatism. Conversion separates one from the roots. Hence, we should strive to stop religious conversion," Bhagwat added. "We have to ensure that 'dharma' should pervade all over," he stated.

218.title: Mistaking it for road, man drives into overflowing lake in Thane; rescued
218.article_body: Locals rescued a cab driver in Thane after he reportedly drove into the overflowing Phadke Pada lake. The water from the lake was flowing on the road, making it invisible to motorists. "I was new to the area...I could see farmland on the right...there was only water on the left...I was unaware that there was a lake there," driver said.

219.title: Mumbai civic body to start doorstep checks for hypertension, diabetes
219.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started to train over 3,000 Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who will be conducting door-to-door screening for diabetes and hypertension across Mumbai. CHVs will identify suspects and direct them to nearest dispensary for confirmatory test. The civic body took the step after it learnt that cases related to non-communicable diseases are on the rise.

220.title: Rhea received drugs and handed them over to Sushant Singh Rajput: Draft charges
220.article_body: According to draft charges submitted against Rhea Chakraborty in a Special NDPS court, the actress received deliveries of drugs from Samuel Miranda, Showik Chakraborty, Dipesh Sawant and others, and handed over those deliveries to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. The draft also states that delivery of drugs for the actor had been taking place since 2018.

221.title: National flag, Coast Guard flags found lying in garbage in Kerala; case filed
221.article_body: A case has been registered after the National flag and the Coast Guard flags were found lying in the garbage in Kochi's Irumpanam region on Tuesday. Besides flags, life jackets and raincoats of the Coast Guard were also found dumped by locals. According to police, the items might have been handed over to be disposed of by the Coast Guard.

222.title: Indian School of Business opens admissions for full-time PGP programme
222.article_body: The Indian School of Business has announced that it is now accepting admission applications for its Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP). The one-year full-time programme has been ranked no. 1 in India and fourth in Asia by FT World MBA Rankings 2022. The programme endows young managers with multidisciplinary perspectives and global exposure, ISB stated.

223.title: Shiv Sena spokesperson Sheetal Mhatre joins Eknath Shinde camp
223.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena party spokesperson and former Mumbai corporator Sheetal Mhatre on Tuesday joined the Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Sena camp. Mhatre, along with some Sena workers, visited Shinde's residence on Tuesday night and expressed their support for him. She had represented ward number 7 in suburban Dahisar in north Mumbai in 2012 and 2017.

224.title: Sena part of MVA but didn’t consult us: Cong leader on Shiv Sena's support to Murmu
224.article_body: Congress leader Balasaheb Thorat said Shiv Sena didn't consult his party before deciding to support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls. "Though Shiv Sena is part of MVA, it didn't consult us about this," he said. Everyone who supports the "Constitution and democracy" is supporting the Opposition's candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, for the post, Thorat added.

225.title: 20-year-old dies of electrocution at Sinhagad road in Pune
225.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was electrocuted after coming in contact with a live wire near Sawai hotel on Pune's Sinhagad road. The electricity company, MSEDCL, said that a broken cable without electricity was hanging on the footpath. "To remove the wire, [the deceased] pulled it. The...cable came in contact with high tension live cable resulting in his death," MSEDCL said.

226.title: In pics: First images of unseen Universe captured by NASA's Webb Telescope
226.article_body: NASA has revealed James Webb Space Telescope's first full-colour images of the unseen Universe. These images include Carina Nebula - the landscape of 'mountains' and 'valleys' speckled with glittering stars, Stephan's Quintet - a grouping of five galaxies showing huge shockwaves and tidal tails, and Southern Ring Nebula which shows a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light.

227.title: India reports 16,906 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 24% higher than yesterday
227.article_body: India has reported 16,906 COVID-19 cases, 15,447 recoveries and 45 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 13,615 cases and 20 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,32,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,519.

228.title: DMRC junks MetroLite plan for Red Line extension
228.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has dropped the plan to run MetroLite, sleeker, tram-like trains, for Red Line extension. MetroLite was initially planned for the area as they were projected to have a limited ridership, but it has been revised due to Delhi government's plans to create a transit-oriented hub in Narela, DMRC MD Vikas Kumar said.

229.title: India responds after reports claim India helped Sri Lanka President escape
229.article_body: After reports claimed that India helped Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa escape, High Commission of India in Colombo said, "High Commission categorically denies baseless and speculative media reports." "It's reiterated that India will continue to support people of Sri Lanka as they seek to realize their aspirations for prosperity and progress through democratic means and values," it added.

230.title: Exciting to get seam and swing in white-ball cricket: Bumrah on 6/19 vs Eng
230.article_body: Talking about his career-best figures of 6/19 in the first ODI against England, Jasprit Bumrah said it was exciting to get swing and seam movement in a white-ball match. "When I bowled the first ball, I found some swing and we tried to exploit that...When the wicket is flat your accuracy is tested," he added. Shami registered figures of 3/31.

231.title: People didn't have any expectations from me: Actress Taapsee Pannu
231.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who will feature in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer ‘Dunki’, said people never expected anything from her as an actress. "It is good to have [such] people,” added Taapsee. “I had three-four flops in South and...started getting tagged as the bad luck charm and someone who shouldn’t be cast in movies because she’s just jinxing,” she had earlier stated.

232.title: Want to con SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only me: Ranbir
232.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has jokingly said he wants to "con" filmmaker SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only him which will be shot on an island. "I [also want to] kiss Lionel Messi's left foot," added Ranbir. Rajamouli earlier termed Ranbir as his favourite actor in Bollywood. "You can feel the [performance's] intensity...through his eyes and subtle expressions," he'd said.

233.title: We came 3rd in two-horse race: Buttler on 10-wicket defeat in 1st India ODI
233.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said they "came third in a two-horse race" after losing the first ODI against India by 10 wickets on Tuesday. He added, "It's tough to take but we've got to dust ourselves down quickly for [the next] game." Buttler further said they knew the ball might swing in "muggy conditions" but India "exploited conditions fantastically".

234.title: Population explosion not a problem of any religion but entire country: Naqvi
234.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has said that "population explosion" is not a problem of any religion but an issue for the entire country. It is not right to associate it with caste and religion, Naqvi added. "Some people want to create unlimited problems on the pretext of Allah’s mercy," Naqvi stated.

235.title: Don't allow swearing-in of ministers till SC's verdict: Sena to Maha Guv
235.article_body: Shiv Sena wrote to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari stating that since a petition seeking the disqualification of 16 legislators was pending in Supreme Court (SC), he should not allow the swearing-in of any minister until the court's decision. "Rewarding persons against whom disqualification proceedings are pending...would be destructive of the Constitutional scheme," the letter added.

236.title: 32 fish kill incidents recorded across B'luru lakes in last 5 yrs: Report
236.article_body: About 32 fish kill incidents were reported across Bengaluru lakes in the last five years, said a report by non-profit organisation ActionAid Association. Of these, eight incidents took place in the last seven months, it added. Based on the number of fish deaths, the report further identified Madiwala, Haralur, Bellandur and Kommaghatta lakes as most vulnerable to fish kill incidents.

237.title: 6 die in 24 hours amid heavy rains in Gujarat; death toll rises to 69
237.article_body: As many as six people died in rain-related incidents amid heavy rains in Gujarat in the last 24 hours, state Disaster Management Minister Rajendra Trivedi said. The death toll in rain-related incidents in the state since June 1 has risen to 69, he added. A 50-year-old man died after being swept off by floodwaters in Rajkot.

238.title: Pune receives 165.7 mm rainfall; Khadakwasla dam overflows
238.article_body: Pune on Tuesday received 165.7 mm of rainfall which is 26% less than normal. Khadakwasla dam overflowed and its water capacity reached 95% on Tuesday. With the prediction of more rains in the next few days, 905 cusecs water was released from new Mutha right canal and 11,900 cusecs was released from the spillway of the dam into Mutha river.

239.title: 'Oh the irony lol' tweets Elon Musk after Twitter sues him
239.article_body: Minutes after news surfaced that Twitter has sued him for breaching the $44 billion contract, Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to the microblogging site and tweeted, "Oh the irony lol". As per The Verge, the lawsuit was filed in Delaware's Court of Chancery, accusing Musk of hypocrisy. Twitter is represented by M&A law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.

240.title: Rohit breaks Afridi's world record, becomes fastest batter to reach 250 ODI sixes
240.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma on Tuesday broke former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi's world record for being the fastest batter to reach 250 sixes in ODI cricket. Rohit took 224 innings to reach 250 sixes. Afridi had taken 259 innings to reach the milestone. Rohit slammed five sixes against England on Tuesday to complete 250 sixes in ODI cricket.

241.title: Water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crosses full tank level
241.article_body: Following heavy rains across Telangana, the water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crossed the full tank level on Tuesday. The water level was recorded at 513.44 metres against the full tank level of 513.41 metres. According to civic officials, there is no danger from Hussain Sagar, but residents living in downstream areas might be affected if the rain continues.

242.title: Sri Lankan President escapes to Maldives with his wife amid economic crisis
242.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country for the Maldives on Wednesday, hours before he was due to resign amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa, his wife and two bodyguards left aboard a Sri Lankan Air Force plane, an immigration official told Reuters. Rajapaksa would most likely proceed to another Asian country from there, a government source said.

243.title: Shami creates history, becomes fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 wickets in ODI cricket
243.article_body: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami on Tuesday created history by becoming the fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets. With his three wickets in the first ODI against England, Shami took his tally of wickets in ODI cricket to 151 in 80 matches. Ajit Agarkar was the previous fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets, taking 97 matches.

244.title: India overtake Pakistan in latest ODI team rankings
244.article_body: India have overtaken Pakistan in the latest ICC ODI team rankings after their 10-wicket victory in the first ODI of their three-match series against England on Tuesday. India moved to the third position in the rankings with 108 rating points, leaving Pakistan behind at the fourth position with 106 points. Before the match, India were placed fourth with 105 points.

245.title: Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six hits girl in the stands, video surfaces
245.article_body: During the fifth over of India's innings against England in the first ODI, Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six went on to hit a girl in the stands. It resulted in play being halted for a short while. A video surfaced online showing a man consoling the girl. England's physio and team doctor were seen rushing towards the girl.

246.title: DMRC plans to start 3-car metro train service for 1st time in Delhi
246.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC), for the first time, has planned to start a three-car metro train service from Narela to the Rithala section. "DMRC will have a proper metro but initially it will construct three-coach train platforms and later extend the facility to run six-coach trains in future," DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. "These are currently proposals," he added.

247.title: Twitter sues Elon Musk for backing out of $44 billion deal
247.article_body: Twitter has sued Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. "Musk apparently believes that he...is free to change his mind, trash the company...and walk away," said the lawsuit. Musk said he was terminating the deal because Twitter violated the agreement by failing to respond to requests for information regarding fake or spam accounts.

248.title: Delhi Metro to launch e-auto service for last mile connectivity
248.article_body: The Delhi Metro will soon launch its first e-auto service to boost last-mile connectivity for commuters, officials said. A batch of 50 e-vehicles will be launched from Dwarka Sector-9 station and a total of 136 autos will be present in the sub-city, DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. Charging points and other arrangements are being made at the station.

249.title: 46-year-old man killed by speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash
249.article_body: A 46-year-old man was allegedly killed by a speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash area on Sunday, police said on Tuesday. The victim was hit by the car while he was walking and was thrown onto the pavement, police added. Police further said the victim was lying unconscious on the pavement for a long time before a passerby spotted him.

250.title: World's most powerful telescope captures 'water signature' on distant planet
250.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the distinct signature of water in the atmosphere of a distant planet orbiting a Sun-like star 1,150 light-years away. It has been captured on the giant gas planet WASP 96-b located in the Milky Way. NASA made the revelation while releasing a batch of photos taken by the world's most powerful telescope.

251.title: I think Tom Cruise is irrelevant, he's been doing the same part for 35 yrs: Mickey Rourke
251.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke called Tom Cruise "irrelevant" and said "he has no respect" for how Tom chooses his roles. In an interview, Mickey was asked what he felt about Tom starring in 'Top Gun: Maverick', to which he replied, "That doesn't mean sh** to me...[He's]...been doing the same...part for 35 years." Mickey added he doesn't care about money and power.

252.title: Mysterious phenomenon of 'milky sea' caught on camera for first time
252.article_body: A satellite captured an image of a rare case of milky sea in the south of Indonesia, a phenomenon where the water lightens because of luminous bacteria. A team of researchers from the US confirmed a crew on a private yacht encountered the milky sea, something that is believed to appear only once or twice per year around the globe.

253.title: I am an actor because of sir: Rajkummar on mimicking SRK in college days
253.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao recalled how he would mimic actor Shah Rukh Khan when he was studying at The Film and Television Institute of India (FTII). "I used to mimic Shah Rukh Khan and Manoj Kumar, I still like...(Shah Rukh) a lot," he added. "I'm still a huge fan. Me and my friends....we still mimic Shah Rukh sir [sometimes]," Rajkummar said.

254.title: Over 5,000 civilians killed since start of war in Ukraine: UN
254.article_body: The UN human rights office (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that more than 5,000 civilians had been killed and over 6,500 others had been injured in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion on February 24. The real toll was likely much higher, it added. OHCHR has dozens of human rights monitors in the country.

255.title: Manipur orders closure of schools as COVID-19 cases increase
255.article_body: The Manipur government on Tuesday issued an order to close all schools in the state with immediate effect due to the sharp increase in COVID-19 cases. The schools will remain closed till July 24, 2022. This comes as 59 people in Manipur tested positive for the virus on Tuesday and the test positivity ratio crossed the 15% mark.

256.title: Bumrah was just phenomenal in 1st ODI vs England: Tendulkar
256.article_body: Following Jasprit Bumrah's 6/19 in India's 10-wicket win against England in first ODI, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Great bowling performance by India's pace attack especially Bumrah who was just phenomenal." He added, "The Oval pitch has great bounce but Indian bowlers bowled...right lengths." Notably, Bumrah became the first Indian pacer to take six wickets in an ODI in England on Tuesday.

257.title: Opting to bowl first was a right call: Rohit on India's 10-wicket win
257.article_body: After India defeated England by 10 wickets in first ODI at The Oval, captain Rohit Sharma said opting to bowl first after winning the toss was a right call to make by looking at overhead conditions and the pitch. "There was some swing...seam upfront and we exploited them well," he added. India bundled out England for 110 in 25.2 overs.

258.title: Country does not need a silent President: Yashwant Sinha
258.article_body: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.

259.title: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
259.article_body: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.

260.title: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
260.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.

261.title: I stay out of VC ecosystem as I don't believe in it: Zoho Co-founder
261.article_body: Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that he doesn't believe in the venture capital (VC) ecosystem. "I stay out of the VC ecosystem because I fundamentally don't believe in it. The thing I see (with VC-funded companies) is that it's all too exit-focused," he said. Notably, Zoho has never raised any VC funding to date.

262.title: Lightspeed raises new $500 mn fund for India, Southeast Asia
262.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon-valley headquartered firm, has announced the closure of its $500 million fund dedicated to India and Southeast Asia. Lightspeed has invested in OYO, Udaan, BYJU'S, Razorpay, and ShareChat and looks to further invest in early-stage startups. The new fund comes from a $7 billion capital that the VC firm has raised to invest in startups globally.

263.title: Miscreants attack Punjab Advocate General in train near Panipat
263.article_body: Unidentified miscreants attacked Punjab Advocate General Anmol Rattan Sidhu while he was travelling on a Shatabdi train from Delhi to Chandigarh on Tuesday. The assailants allegedly pelted stones at Sidhu's bogie, breaking the windowpane of his compartment after the train crossed Haryana's Panipat. Notably, Sidhu had appeared in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to the Lawrence Bishnoi case.

264.title: J&K sets up transgender welfare board to protect their rights
264.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced that they have set up a transgender welfare board for the protection of the rights of the minority population. The total population of transgenders in Jammu and Kashmir was 4,137 as per the 2011 census. The Chief Secretary will be the head of the 13-member welfare board, an official order stated.

265.title: Activist & Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passes away at 84
265.article_body: Social activist and Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passed away at 84 on Tuesday following a prolonged illness. Kaushal died at a private hospital in Dehradun. He headed the Rural Litigation and Entitlement Kendra NGO which was focused on development work amongst tribal communities in the Dehradun district. He founded the NGO in the late 1970s.

266.title: Karti Chidambaram's bail plea hearing adjourned till August 18
266.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday adjourned the hearing on the anticipatory bail plea of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram till August 18. Justice Poonam A Bamba adjourned the matter since Additional Solicitor General SV Raju was unavailable. Karti is seeking anticipatory bail in a money laundering case related to the Chinese visa scam.

267.title: K'taka bus cleaner dies, his parents praised for donating organs
267.article_body: A 24-year-old bus cleaner from Karnataka has passed away after being critically injured in a road accident last week. The state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised the man's parents for their generosity as they have donated the deceased's organs. "[Naveen Kumar's] liver, kidney, heart valve and retina have been transplanted and will give life to others," the minister tweeted.

268.title: 65-yr-old cheating accused jumps off court building in Surat, dies
268.article_body: Police said that a 65-year-old man, Bharat Italia, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped to death from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. While being escorted back from the court, the accused suddenly escaped and jumped from the building, a police official said. Italia was taken to a hospital where he died.

269.title: Situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive & complicated: Jaishankar
269.article_body: Replying to a media query, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive, it's very complicated. Even as we speak many developments are taking place." India has been extremely supportive of Sri Lankans in the last few months, he added. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is due to step down tomorrow.

270.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
270.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

271.title: Iran arrests 3 filmmakers in less than 1 week amid govt crackdown
271.article_body: Iran has arrested prominent filmmaker Jafar Panahi, the third arrest in less than a week amid a crackdown by the government, reports stated on Tuesday. Panahi had reportedly gone to the prosecutor's office to check on his colleagues, who were detained recently when he was also imprisoned. Panahi has been reportedly sent to jail to serve a previous prison term.

272.title: Venezuelan refugee women face rising violence in Colombia, Peru: Report
272.article_body: Amnesty International in a report on Tuesday said that Venezuelan refugee women face rising gender-based violence in Peru and Colombia. Gender-based violence against Venezuelan women in Colombia increased by 71% between 2018 and 2021, and in Peru by 31% between 2019 and 2021, official government data showed. Over 60 lakh people have fled Venezuela amid an economic crisis.

273.title: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
273.article_body: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.

274.title: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
274.article_body: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.

275.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
275.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

276.title: Miscreants attack Punjab Advocate General in train near Panipat
276.article_body: Unidentified miscreants attacked Punjab Advocate General Anmol Rattan Sidhu while he was travelling on a Shatabdi train from Delhi to Chandigarh on Tuesday. The assailants allegedly pelted stones at Sidhu's bogie, breaking the windowpane of his compartment after the train crossed Haryana's Panipat. Notably, Sidhu had appeared in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to the Lawrence Bishnoi case.

277.title: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
277.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.
