278.article_body: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.

279.title: Venezuelan refugee women face rising violence in Colombia, Peru: Report
279.article_body: Amnesty International in a report on Tuesday said that Venezuelan refugee women face rising gender-based violence in Peru and Colombia. Gender-based violence against Venezuelan women in Colombia increased by 71% between 2018 and 2021, and in Peru by 31% between 2019 and 2021, official government data showed. Over 60 lakh people have fled Venezuela amid an economic crisis.

280.title: Opting to bowl first was a right call: Rohit on India's 10-wicket win
280.article_body: After India defeated England by 10 wickets in first ODI at The Oval, captain Rohit Sharma said opting to bowl first after winning the toss was a right call to make by looking at overhead conditions and the pitch. "There was some swing...seam upfront and we exploited them well," he added. India bundled out England for 110 in 25.2 overs.

281.title: J&K sets up transgender welfare board to protect their rights
281.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced that they have set up a transgender welfare board for the protection of the rights of the minority population. The total population of transgenders in Jammu and Kashmir was 4,137 as per the 2011 census. The Chief Secretary will be the head of the 13-member welfare board, an official order stated.

282.title: World's most powerful telescope captures 'water signature' on distant planet
282.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the distinct signature of water in the atmosphere of a distant planet orbiting a Sun-like star 1,150 light-years away. It has been captured on the giant gas planet WASP 96-b located in the Milky Way. NASA made the revelation while releasing a batch of photos taken by the world's most powerful telescope.

283.title: Bumrah was just phenomenal in 1st ODI vs England: Tendulkar
283.article_body: Following Jasprit Bumrah's 6/19 in India's 10-wicket win against England in first ODI, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Great bowling performance by India's pace attack especially Bumrah who was just phenomenal." He added, "The Oval pitch has great bounce but Indian bowlers bowled...right lengths." Notably, Bumrah became the first Indian pacer to take six wickets in an ODI in England on Tuesday.

284.title: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
284.article_body: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.

285.title: Manipur orders closure of schools as COVID-19 cases increase
285.article_body: The Manipur government on Tuesday issued an order to close all schools in the state with immediate effect due to the sharp increase in COVID-19 cases. The schools will remain closed till July 24, 2022. This comes as 59 people in Manipur tested positive for the virus on Tuesday and the test positivity ratio crossed the 15% mark.

286.title: Lightspeed raises new $500 mn fund for India, Southeast Asia
286.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon-valley headquartered firm, has announced the closure of its $500 million fund dedicated to India and Southeast Asia. Lightspeed has invested in OYO, Udaan, BYJU'S, Razorpay, and ShareChat and looks to further invest in early-stage startups. The new fund comes from a $7 billion capital that the VC firm has raised to invest in startups globally.

287.title: K'taka bus cleaner dies; minister praises parents for donating organs
287.article_body: A 24-year-old bus cleaner from Karnataka has passed away after being critically injured in a road accident last week. The state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised the man's parents for their generosity as they have donated the deceased's organs. "[Naveen Kumar's] liver, kidney, heart valve and retina have been transplanted and will give life to others," the minister tweeted.

288.title: Situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive & complicated: Jaishankar
288.article_body: Replying to a media query, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive, it's very complicated. Even as we speak many developments are taking place." India has been extremely supportive of Sri Lankans in the last few months, he added. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is due to step down tomorrow.

289.title: I am an actor because of sir: Rajkummar on mimicking SRK in college days
289.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao recalled how he would mimic actor Shah Rukh Khan when he was studying at The Film and Television Institute of India (FTII). "I used to mimic Shah Rukh Khan and Manoj Kumar, I still like...(Shah Rukh) a lot," he added. "I'm still a huge fan. Me and my friends....we still mimic Shah Rukh sir [sometimes]," Rajkummar said.

290.title: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
290.article_body: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.

291.title: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
291.article_body: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.

292.title: Mysterious phenomenon of 'milky sea' caught on camera for first time
292.article_body: A satellite captured an image of a rare case of milky sea in the south of Indonesia, a phenomenon where the water lightens because of luminous bacteria. A team of researchers from the US confirmed a crew on a private yacht encountered the milky sea, something that is believed to appear only once or twice per year around the globe.

293.title: Over 5,000 civilians killed since start of war in Ukraine: UN
293.article_body: The UN human rights office (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that more than 5,000 civilians had been killed and over 6,500 others had been injured in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion on February 24. The real toll was likely much higher, it added. OHCHR has dozens of human rights monitors in the country.

294.title: Activist & Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passes away at 84
294.article_body: Social activist and Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passed away at 84 on Tuesday following a prolonged illness. Kaushal died at a private hospital in Dehradun. He headed the Rural Litigation and Entitlement Kendra NGO which was focused on development work amongst tribal communities in the Dehradun district. He founded the NGO in the late 1970s.

295.title: Karti Chidambaram's bail plea hearing adjourned till August 18
295.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday adjourned the hearing on the anticipatory bail plea of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram till August 18. Justice Poonam A Bamba adjourned the matter since Additional Solicitor General SV Raju was unavailable. Karti is seeking anticipatory bail in a money laundering case related to the Chinese visa scam.

296.title: Iran arrests 3 filmmakers in less than 1 week amid govt crackdown
296.article_body: Iran has arrested prominent filmmaker Jafar Panahi, the third arrest in less than a week amid a crackdown by the government, reports stated on Tuesday. Panahi had reportedly gone to the prosecutor's office to check on his colleagues, who were detained recently when he was also imprisoned. Panahi has been reportedly sent to jail to serve a previous prison term.

297.title: I think Tom Cruise is irrelevant, he's been doing the same part for 35 yrs: Mickey Rourke
297.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke called Tom Cruise "irrelevant" and said "he has no respect" for how Tom chooses his roles. In an interview, Mickey was asked what he felt about Tom starring in 'Top Gun: Maverick', to which he replied, "That doesn't mean sh** to me...[He's]...been doing the same...part for 35 years." Mickey added he doesn't care about money and power.

298.title: I stay out of VC ecosystem as I don't believe in it: Zoho Co-founder
298.article_body: Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that he doesn't believe in the venture capital (VC) ecosystem. "I stay out of the VC ecosystem because I fundamentally don't believe in it. The thing I see (with VC-funded companies) is that it's all too exit-focused," he said. Notably, Zoho has never raised any VC funding to date.

299.title: 65-yr-old cheating accused jumps off court building in Surat, dies
299.article_body: Police said that a 65-year-old man, Bharat Italia, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped to death from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. While being escorted back from the court, the accused suddenly escaped and jumped from the building, a police official said. Italia was taken to a hospital where he died.

300.title: Croatia to become 20th country to adopt euro as currency
300.article_body: European Union (EU) on Tuesday formally approved Croatia's accession to the eurozone, paving the way for the Balkan nation to adopt euro as its currency from January 1, 2023. This confirms that the euro remained an "attractive, resilient and successful global currency", European Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said. "It's a big day for Croatia," the Croatian Finance Minister said.

301.title: 1st batch of full-colour images taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
301.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new full-colour images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

302.title: Drug peddler's properties worth ₹83.2 lakh attached in Haryana
302.article_body: The properties of a drug peddler, Gurmez Singh alias Gurmail, were attached and his assets were frozen in Haryana's Kaithal district on Tuesday. Police said Singh had purchased properties worth ₹83.22 lakh from the proceeds of drug peddling. "On the request of Haryana Police, a competent authority in New Delhi, passed orders to freeze movable and immovable assets," police said.

303.title: ODI or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket: Sehwag on Bumrah, Shami
303.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami following their bowling performances in the first ODI against England, Virender Sehwag said, "One day cricket or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket. Bumrah and Shami are a class apart." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 7.2-3-19-6, while Shami registered 7-0-31-3. India defeated England by 10 wickets at The Oval.

304.title: Assam govt appoints 280 specially-abled candidates as teachers
304.article_body: Assam government on Tuesday distributed appointment letters to 280 specially-abled candidates for the post of teachers across different schools in various districts of the state. The letters were distributed by Assam Education Minister Dr Ranoj Pegu during a programme held in Guwahati. As many as 193 candidates were appointed in lower primary schools and the rest in upper primary schools.

305.title: New images of the universe taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
305.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of the Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

306.title: Staff misbehaved, made racist remarks: Khali on allegedly slapping toll staffer
306.article_body: After a Punjab toll staff accused former WWE wrestler Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali of slapping one of the employees, the latter said the staffer had stopped his car and "misbehaved for a selfie". "When I denied the selfie, they ruthlessly passed racist comments and used bad words," said Khali. A video of the argument earlier went viral.

307.title: Coronavirus pandemic is nowhere near over: WHO chief
307.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said, "COVID-19 is nowhere near over." "As the virus pushes at us, we must push back," he added. WHO's Emergency Committee, made up of independent experts, said rising cases, ongoing viral evolution and pressure on health services in a number of countries meant that the situation was still an emergency.

308.title: Bless and support me: Droupadi Murmu to YSRCP leaders in Andhra
308.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu met YSRCP leaders in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati on Tuesday as part of her election campaign and requested them to bless and support her. "Andhra and Odisha are neighbours and have many similarities in food habits, dress and customs," Murmu said. "I thank Jagan Mohan Reddy for extending support even before I requested," she added.

309.title: It'll take 89m plus to win in Eugene: Neeraj ahead of World Athletics C'ships
309.article_body: Ahead of World Athletics Championships 2022, reigning Olympic gold medallist javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said there is no pressure. "I train well and give [my] 100% in competition," he added. Neeraj, who threw a personal best of 89.94 metres at Stockholm Diamond League last month said, "I'm close to 90 metres...it'll take 89 metres plus to win in Eugene."

310.title: Jharkhand will become leading state if Centre's support continues: CM
310.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that the state would be one of the leading states in the next five to seven years if support from the Centre continued. "Jharkhand has been contributing to nation building for years through its minerals, including coal and iron," Soren said, reminding that the state's contribution should not be forgotten.

311.title: Drone startups raise $87 mn since new govt rules in 2021
311.article_body: After the change in rules for the drone sector in August 2021, the industry has seen a funding boost of $87 million in the last year, according market researcher Venture Intelligence's data. As more sectors use drones, 10 startups received funding, double from last year. Companies such as ideaForge raised $20 million, and The ePlane Company raised $5 million.

312.title: Rajkummar, Sanya host screening of 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police
312.article_body: Actors Rajkummar Rao and Sanya Malhotra along with director Sailesh Kolanu hosted a special screening of their upcoming film 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police on Monday. Actress Huma Qureshi also attended the screening. Delhi Police officials were extremely happy with the film's story and appreciated it for showcasing the real investigative police world, reported Free Press Journal.

313.title: Sonali revisits hospital where she underwent cancer treatment, says 'Was unreal'
313.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre shared a video on her Instagram handle, recalling her cancer journey as she revisited the same hospital where she underwent cancer treatment. Sharing the video, she wrote, "Four years later, from sheer terror to continued hope, so much has changed yet so much remains the same. It was unreal...I felt like telling the patients that there's hope."

314.title: 5,000 Delhi govt school kids given free CUET coaching classes: Sisodia
314.article_body: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia revealed that over 5,000 Delhi government school students were provided free preparatory classes for Common University Entrance Test (CUET). Many students couldn't afford high coaching fees, he said, adding, "The initiative ensured that [they] don't consider giving up dreams because of financial reasons." The students were guided in over 13 subjects.

315.title: Govt cracks down on industrial usage of urea intended for farmers
315.article_body: The Chemicals and Fertilizers Ministry has launched a nationwide crackdown to curb the use of agricultural-grade urea by industries. The ministry also launched a flying squad for taking strict action against this. According to an official, the diversion causes subsidy leakage worth ₹6,000 crore while leakages worth ₹100 crore were identified in the last 2.5 months.

316.title: German auto components firm Bosch to invest over ₹200 crore in India
316.article_body: German auto components firm Bosch will invest ₹200 crore in India over next five years in advanced automotive technologies and digital mobility space, Managing Director Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company is also "quietly and cautiously" optimistic about having double-digit growth in FY2022-23 over the previous fiscal, he added. In 2021-22, Bosch recorded a profit after tax of ₹1,217 crore.

317.title: CBI may question senior journalist in NSE phone tapping case: Report
317.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is likely to question a senior journalist in Mumbai in connection with the alleged phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees, Moneycontrol reported. CBI found the journalist had introduced former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey to former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Pandey is also being probed in the matter.

318.title: I will only make 'Thor 5' with Chris Hemsworth: Taika Waititi
318.article_body: Filmmaker Taika Waititi has stated that he will only make another 'Thor' film if actor Chris Hemsworth is a part of it. "But it would need to be something surprising and unexpected for me to want to do it...The battles and...the fighting is fine, but I would want something that feels unexpected when it comes to the story," he added.

319.title: Nothing is planned yet: Suniel on rumours of Athiya, Rahul getting married
319.article_body: Suniel Shetty reacted to the reports that his daughter, Athiya Shetty, and cricketer KL Rahul are getting married in the next three months. Dismissing the rumours, Suniel said, "Nothing has been planned yet." A report in a news portal suggested that the couple has apparently bought a place together and will move into their new house after tying the knot.

320.title: CUET will be conducted in 2 phases starting July 15: UGC
320.article_body: The Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission to UG courses will be conducted in two phases starting from July 15, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said. The examinations will end on August 20. The admit cards for the first phase were issued today. "We're issuing admit cards just four days before...examinations...to ensure good security," Kumar said.

321.title: Never seen such shameless misuse of central agencies: Sinha
321.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha on Tuesday criticised the Central government and said that he's never seen such blatant, shameless misuse of central agencies to fix rivals. He said that elections for the post of President are taking place in troubled conditions, adding that democracy is in grave danger. The economy is badly mismanaged, he added.

322.title: Fintech startup Hesa to financially empower 60,000 rural merchants
322.article_body: Hyderabad-based agri-fintech startup Hesa announced that it's aiming to provide financial solutions to 60,000 rural entrepreneurs including farmers across 30,000 villages in Telangana. Through this programme, Hesa will offer ease of transactions such as bill payments, opening an account, withdrawing money, among others. It aims to reduce the financial challenges faced by the rural population.

323.title: BJP is a 'control-freak', 'dossier-loving' government: Congress MP
323.article_body: Congress MP Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday accused the BJP of being a "control freak" and "dossier loving" government. Singhvi further said the BJP government has created an atmosphere of "fear, trepidation, anxiety and hesitation" among the judicial sector by the misuse of the "dossier raj". "BJP has indulged in several manipulative tactics qua the judiciary," Singhvi added.

324.title: SC upholds life terms for 4 convicts for plotting terror attacks
324.article_body: The Supreme Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to four people for plotting terror attacks in India. The convicts, guilty of having links with Lashkar-e-Taiba, were arrested during investigations of the 2005 attack at Bangalore's Indian Institute of Science. The convicts had moved the Supreme Court after the Karnataka High Court increased their seven-year sentence to life term.

325.title: India defeat England by 10 wickets in an ODI for the first time in history
325.article_body: India chased down a 111-run target against England in 18.4 overs without losing a wicket to win the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It's the first time in ODI cricket history that India defeated England by a margin of 10 wickets. England were bowled out for 110 runs in the match, which is their lowest ODI total against India.

326.title: Was rejected for my eyebrows, I was like 'What about acting?': Rajkummar
326.article_body: When asked about his early days and the kind of rejections he faced, Rajkummar Rao said, "I was told so many things. You're not tall enough, your build is not right, your eyebrows are a little…not in a certain shape." "[I heard] very weird things. I was like ‘What? What about acting?’ Voh kisko chahiye? (Who wants that?)" he added.

327.title: Audience is now used to consuming content at home: Naga Chaitanya
327.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya stated that the priority of the audience has shifted now, adding that they have become used to the idea of consuming content at home. He added that he chooses scripts based on this. "They are not putting down the film or insulting it in any way. It's just...how they have evolved post the pandemic," the actor said.

328.title: Can't take my eyes off this performance: Bhogle on Bumrah's 6/19 at The Oval
328.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to praise India pacer Jasprit Bumrah following his 6/19 in the first ODI against England at The Oval. "What a spell! Can't take my eyes off this performance by Bumrah," he wrote. Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Alexa, please play Bumrah. Sorry, Bumrah is unplayable." England were bowled out for 110 in 25.2 overs.

329.title: Around 60 startups have registered with ISRO: MoS Jitendra Singh
329.article_body: Minister of State for Science, Technology and Space Jitendra Singh said that around 60 startups have registered with ISRO since PM Narendra Modi "unlocked" the space sector. He added that while a few startups are dealing with space debris management, proposals have also been received for other services. He also lauded the PM for allowing private players in space sector.

330.title: Russian journalist fined ₹1.6 lakh under 'gay propaganda' law
330.article_body: A Russian journalist was fined 120,000 roubles (₹1.6 lakh) by a Moscow court on Tuesday under law that prohibits "propaganda" in support of gay relationships. Yury Dud, who has notably also denounced Russian invasion of Ukraine, was fined due to interview he conducted with a homosexual artist, lawyer said. Russia criminalised "propagandising" non-traditional sexual orientations to minors in 2013.

331.title: Kichcha Sudeepa pays school fees of two students in Bengaluru
331.article_body: Actor-singer Kichcha Sudeepa has assisted two students in their education by paying their school fees. The students, who attend Chamarajpet Ram Mandir school in Bengaluru, were unable to go to school because of financial issues. Earlier, he had adopted a government school in his home town Shivamogga in Karnataka which is said to be around 133 years old.

332.title: Govt will raise funds from capital market for road projects: Gadkari
332.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that the government will raise funds from capital markets for road projects. "I don't want to use the finances of rich people. I'm going to share market, and...I'm going to take investments from small people," he said. The construction equipment industry is facing problems due to rising crude oil prices, he added.

333.title: I am naturally disappointed: Vijay Mallya on 4-month jail sentence
333.article_body: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said he was "naturally disappointed" at the Supreme Court verdict sentencing him to four months in jail in a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The apex court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him.

334.title: First made-in-India qHPV vaccine against cervical cancer in women gets DCGI's approval
334.article_body: The DCGI granted market authorisation to Serum Institute of India (SII) to manufacture indigenously-developed India's first Quadrivalent Human Papillomavirus vaccine (qHPV) against cervical cancer in women. Saying the vaccine will be "affordable and accessible", SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said, "We look forward to launching it later this year and we thank...DCGI @MoHFW_INDIA for granting approval."

335.title: It was a good learning: Suryakumar on his 117 in India's 17-run loss
335.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who scored his maiden T20I century(117) in third T20I against England, said he's happy with the way things went in Nottingham. "At the same time I felt that there was a slight opportunity to take the team past the line. It happens, it was a learning process," he added. India lost the match by 17 runs.

336.title: I was approached for 'Aarya' but it didn't work for me: Kajol Devgan
336.article_body: Kajol Devgan said she was approached for 'Aarya'. When asked if she has watched the show, Kajol said, "I did…I liked the script very much. But it didn’t work out for me...at that time." ''Was it due to date issues? There were other reasons for it," she added. The series was later remade with Sushmita Sen as the titular character.

337.title: 3 Kerala men found guilty of recruiting youngsters to Islamic State
337.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has found three men from Kerala guilty of recruiting youngsters to the Islamic State with the intention of waging a war against India. Earlier, the NIA found that one of the accused, 60-year-old UK Hamsa, acted as a propagandist of the IS ideology in Kerala and helped radicalise around 20 youngsters.

338.title: ASI martyred, 2 policemen injured as terrorists open fire in J&K
338.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was martyred and two other police personnel sustained injuries after terrorists open fired upon a police party in the Lal Bazar area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday. The injured personnel have been shifted to a hospital. Police said the area has been cordoned off to track down the attackers, who managed to escape.

339.title: Rahul leaves for personal visit abroad, to skip key Congress meeting
339.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left for a personal visit overseas on Tuesday, the party confirmed, but didn't disclose any details about the visit. Rahul will skip a crucial Congress meeting on July 14 to discuss the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and internal party elections. All senior Congress members, including general secretaries, in-charges and PCC presidents, have been invited to the meeting.

340.title: Side-by-side pics show how powerful James Webb Space Telescope is compared to Hubble
340.article_body: Hours after the first image captured by the James Webb Space Telescope was released, Twitter users shared photos comparing the new telescope with its predecessor Hubble. Many users posted side-by-side images to show the difference between them. While the images taken by James Webb telescope are sharper, those captured by Hubble appear to lack in details.

341.title: Jharkhand to get airports in Bokaro, Jamshedpur & Dumka: Scindia
341.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that Jharkhand will get three more airports, taking the total number of airports in the state to five. The new airports will be built in Bokaro, Jamshedpur and Dumka, he added. Scindia also said that 14 new air routes will be made available in the state to increase connectivity.

342.title: I cut off from people after divorce with Karan Singh Grover: Jennifer Winget
342.article_body: Actress Jennifer Winget has revealed that she cut off from people after her divorce with actor Karan Singh Grover. She said, "I used to see people looking at me with those sad, sympathetic eyes like, 'Arrey bechari yaar,' and that used to piss me off more." Jennifer and Karan got married in 2012 and separated in 2014.

343.title: BRO reconstructs bridge destroyed by flash flood in Arunachal in 7 days
343.article_body: The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) has reconstructed a strategic bridge in Kurung Kumey district of Arunachal Pradesh in seven days. The Bailey Bridge on Koloriang-Lee-Huri road in the district was destroyed in a major flash flood earlier this month. The reconstruction was a challenging task posed by tough circumstances including incessant rains and landslides, a senior official said.

344.title: Tough for Bhuvneshwar to get in India XI for T20 WC with Bumrah, Shami: Gough
344.article_body: Ex-England pacer Darren Gough said it will be difficult for Bhuvneshwar Kumar to get in the T20 World Cup playing XI with Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami already in the side and with youngsters who are coming through having terrific pace. He added that with Bhuvneshwar's swing bowling skills he will be a massive player for India in Australia.

345.title: Shortcut politics can destroy the nation: PM Modi in Deoghar
345.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jharkhand's Deoghar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that shortcut politics based on populist measures can destroy the nation. "If the politics of one country depends on shortcut politics, then it will lead to a short circuit," PM Modi said. "Those who do politics of shortcut will never build new airports, modern highways," he added.

346.title: 2 killed, 4 injured in a road accident in Assam's Dhemaji
346.article_body: Police said that two persons were killed and four others were critically injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling hit the railing of a damaged bridge in Assam's Dhemaji district on Tuesday. The driver of the vehicle, carrying eight passengers from Arunachal Pradesh's Pasighat to Assam's Silapathar lost control, killing two persons on the spot, police added.

347.title: Over 60 killed in Pak's Balochistan in rain-related incidents
347.article_body: As many as 62 people, including 24 children, have lost their lives in Pakistan's Balochistan due to rain-related incidents, officials said. Torrential rains in the region have reportedly destroyed more than 670 houses and injured about 50 people. Separately, the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted "heavy to very heavy" rains in Karachi from July 14 to July 17.

348.title: Sara says she wants to date Vijay Deverakonda on 'Koffee...', actor reacts
348.article_body: The new promo of celebrity talk show 'Koffee With Karan' shows actress Sara Ali Khan saying that she wants to date Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda. Vijay shared a video of the promo on Instagram Stories, writing, "I love how you say 'Deverakonda'. Cutest. Sending big hugs and my affection." Sara will appear on the show with actress Janhvi Kapoor.

349.title: I think I'm more Nadal than I am Federer: Golfer Mcllroy
349.article_body: Golfer Rory Mcllroy said he's more like Rafael Nadal than Roger Federer. "But I'm not. I just don't have his [Nadal] grit and will," he added. Mcllroy further said that he still loves playing golf like 40-year-old Federer still loves playing tennis after having an unbelievably successful and long career. Federer has won 20 Grand Slams and Nadal 22.

350.title: 4 of family, including 2 children, die of electrocution in T'gana
350.article_body: Police said four members of a family, including two children, died due to electrocution in Telangana's Kamareddy on Tuesday. The incident took place when a live wire running from a pole to their house fell on them due to incessant rains, killing 35-year-old Ahmed, 30-year-old Parveen, six-year-old Maheen and four-year-old Adnan. A case was registered under Section 174 of CrPC.

351.title: US airstrike kills leader of Islamic State in Syria
351.article_body: Maher al-Agal, one of the top five ISIS leaders and the leader of ISIS in Syria, has been killed in a US air strike, the US military said on Tuesday. A senior ISIS official closely associated with Maher was seriously injured during the strike. "An initial review indicates there were no civilian casualties," the statement added.

352.title: England record their lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket
352.article_body: England were dismissed for 110 runs in 25.2 overs against India in the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It is England's lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket. As many as four England batters were dismissed without scoring a run in the match. England's previous lowest ODI total against India was 125, registered on October 15, 2006 in Jaipur.

353.title: Bumrah records best-ever ODI bowling figures by an Indian outside Asia
353.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has set the record for registering the best-ever bowling figures in an ODI by an Indian bowler outside Asia. The 28-year-old registered figures of 7.2-3-19-6 against England in the first ODI at The Oval to set the record. The previous record was held by Kuldeep Yadav, who had recorded 10-0-25-6 against England in Nottingham.

354.title: Thailand to offer chemical castration to sex offenders in return for shorter jail term
354.article_body: Thailand is close to enacting a law allowing voluntary chemical castration of sex offenders. A Bill has been passed by the Thai Senate that will enable authorities to offer chemical castration to sex criminals in return to have their prison sentences shortened. Convicts will be offered injections to reduce their testosterone levels as part of the castration treatment.

355.title: Bajrang Dal worker assaulted by 5 men in Karnataka, 2 arrested
355.article_body: A Bajrang Dal worker named Kantharaj has alleged that five men assaulted him in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Monday night. In a police complaint, Kantharaj claimed the men had ambushed him outside his house. In an interview with Times Now, he said he was attacked only because of his connection to the Bajrang Dal. Two of the accused have been arrested.

356.title: Sri Lankan Prez hasn't taken refuge at Air Force chief's home, says SLAF
356.article_body: A Sri Lanka Air Force spokesman on Tuesday rejected reports that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was currently staying at a house belonging to SLAF chief Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana. "There was no truth behind the reports and it was propaganda to tarnish the image of the SLAF and its chief," he added. Pathirana also rejected the claim made by the reports.

357.title: Aamir was constantly on painkillers while filming 'Laal...' running scene: Report
357.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan was constantly on painkillers while filming the running sequence in his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', as per reports. The actor had reportedly suffered a knee injury and was undergoing physiotherapy at the time. The reports added that Aamir didn't want to wait for the shoot because the film had already been delayed due to the pandemic.

358.title: Vidyut Jammwal & Nandita Mahtani to tie the knot in London this month: Reports
358.article_body: Vidyut Jammwal will reportedly tie the knot with fashion designer Nandita Mahtani in London this month. According to reports, they might make the news of their wedding public in the next 15 days. Nandita is currently in London and Vidyut will reportedly join her soon. Vidyut confirmed he's dating Nandita by sharing a picture with her on Instagram last year.

359.title: 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism: Karan Johar
359.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that his upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism, adding that it is good since it helps him improve. "I read the criticism before the praise...What's bad or what's mediocre needs to be told," he added. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

360.title: HCL Tech Q1 profit rises 2.11% to ₹3,281 crore, company declares ₹10 dividend
360.article_body: HCL Technologies on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,281 crore in the June quarter, up 2.11% from ₹3,213 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company's consolidated revenue increased by 16.92% to ₹23,464 crore as against ₹20,068 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company has declared a dividend of ₹10 per share.

361.title: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains booked for ignoring court summons
361.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains was booked for skipping court summons a day after he surrendered before a Ludhiana court in a rape case. An FIR under Section 174A of the Indian Penal Code has been registered at the division number 5 police station on the orders of Chief Judicial Magistrate Sumit Makkar.

362.title: Indian eagle-owl rescued from school premises in Thane amid rains
362.article_body: An Indian eagle-owl was rescued from a school in Thane on Monday amidst heavy rainfall. "The owl was attacked by crows and was trying to hide in the school. It was wet and in trauma," a member of NGO Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) said. A veterinarian has confirmed that there were no external or internal injuries.

363.title: BJP leaders should support 'old friend' Sinha in Prez polls: Baghel
363.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday appealed to the BJP leaders to support "their old friend Yashwant Sinha" in the upcoming Presidential elections. "If the BJP is listening to its inner voice, their old friend (Yashwant Sinha) is the candidate of the Opposition," he said when asked about BJP's appeal to support NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu.

364.title: Fire breaks out in building in Delhi's Janakpuri, 4 rescued
364.article_body: A fire broke out in an office in Delhi's Janakpuri on Tuesday. The fire was reported on the 11th floor of the Kirti Shikhar tower located near Janak Puri Police Station. Around 11 fire tenders attended the scene and four persons were rescued. According to officials, no casualty was reported. They said the incident was reported at around 12:30 pm.

365.title: It was blown out of proportion: Vikram on hospitalisation over chest discomfort
365.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram has reacted to the reports of being hospitalised over a heart attack, saying that he had suffered mild chest discomfort. "But it was blown out of proportion. I am doing well," the actor added. He was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday ahead of the audio launch of his upcoming Tamil film 'Cobra'.

366.title: Crocodile held captive in MP as people claim it 'swallowed' 10-yr-old boy, pic surfaces
366.article_body: A crocodile was captured by residents of a village who insisted that the reptile had swallowed a 10-year-old boy bathing in a river in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur district. The villagers captured the crocodile using a net, insisting that the child was still alive in its stomach, an official said. A team from the police and forest department rescued the crocodile.

367.title: Woman extorts ₹56 lakh from elected representative in Mumbai, booked
367.article_body: Mumbai's Sakinaka Police have booked a woman for allegedly extorting ₹56 lakh from an elected representative in Maharashtra by threatening to tarnish his personal and political image. According to police, the woman met complainant in 2020 and sought monetary assistance from him. She allegedly blackmailed the man, claiming that she'll expose their 'illicit affair' if he didn't give the money.

368.title: Tamil Nadu CM tests COVID-19 positive, urges citizens to wear masks
368.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus and is under isolation. Taking to Twitter, the CM added that he got himself tested as he was "feeling a bit tired". Stalin also urged citizens to wear masks, get vaccinated against COVID-19 and stay safe.

369.title: Statue atop Parliament is a copy of National Emblem: Sculptor on 'distortion' claims
369.article_body: Sculptor Sunil Deore has refuted claims of 'distorting' expression of lions in the National Emblem statue installed on top of the new Parliament building. "We've tried to perfectly copy the sculpture at Sarnath," said Deore, adding, "We studied the original sculpture before enlarging it." Many opposition leaders have claimed the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

370.title: I feel like an underdog, people don't consider me among top heroines: Taapsee
370.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she doesn't feel "very settled with" the fact that she's headlining films now. "I still feel like an underdog. If you ask a layman who are...top 2-3 heroines of the industry, I don’t think I'll be on that list," she added. "You have those days when you feel...Why am I still not there," Taapsee said.

371.title: 3 arrested for mobile phone thefts in Mumbai, 26 phones recovered
371.article_body: Three people were arrested and 26 stolen mobile phones were recovered from their possession in Mumbai's Kurla, police said on Tuesday. One of the accused (Arif Khokhar) stole mobile phones and sold them to the other accused at a cheaper rate, a police official said. Khokhar is a drug addict with multiple mobile phone thefts to his name, he added.

372.title: Barmy Army troll Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England, fans react
372.article_body: England's Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England due to a groin strain. Sharing a picture, Barmy Army insinuated that Kohli has been dropped and injury was just an excuse. "This is disrespectful. You guys are crossing limits," a fan tweeted. Another wrote, "It'll be better you google 'How to play Bumrah' rather than making...useless memes."

373.title: England record lowest-ever score at the fall of 5th wicket against India in ODI cricket
373.article_body: England today recorded the lowest-ever score at the fall of fifth wicket against India in ODIs. England were restricted to 26/5 in 7.5 overs in the first ODI. Jason Roy, Joe Root, Ben Stokes and Liam Livingstone got out without scoring a run. The previous lowest ODI score at the fall of fifth wicket against India was 29/5 by Pakistan.

374.title: Siblings aged 4,5 & 8 drown in pit filled with rainwater in Pune
374.article_body: Three siblings, aged four, five and eight, drowned in a pit filled with rainwater on a farm in Ambethan village under the Pune district on Tuesday. Farmers had dug up a pit in which water had accumulated after heavy rain, said Inspector Dnyaneshwar Sabale, in-charge of Mahalunge police station. Siblings were playing on the farm in the morning, he added.

375.title: Class 12 student arrested for 'objectionable' FB post on UP CM
375.article_body: A Class 12 student has been arrested for allegedly posting an objectionable photograph of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Facebook, police said. The accused, an 18-year-old boy named Ashish Yadav, had allegedly drawn something on the photograph. Police said they've seized his mobile phone and are investigating his other posts. Yadav is a resident of a village in Talgram.

376.title: Erdogan and Putin discussed Ukraine, duo to meet soon: Kremlin
376.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a telephonic discussion regarding facilitation of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea, the Kremlin said on Monday. Both leaders plan to meet in the near future following the discussion, the Kremlin added. Turkey has been mediating between Moscow and Kyiv since the beginning of the ongoing war.

377.title: He's a great kid but he's got demons, in a way: McEnroe on Kyrgios
377.article_body: Talking about 2022 Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the Australian is a great kid and he's well liked in the locker room. "He does a lot of charity work. But he's got demons, in a way," he added. "Kyrgios moves the needle for us in tennis, we need this big time," McEnroe further said.

378.title: 10 Nigerians arrested in Gr Noida for possessing cannabis, liquor
378.article_body: Ten Nigerian nationals were arrested for possessing cannabis and a large quantity of liquor in Greater Noida on Monday. Over 300 gms of cannabis, 217 cans and bottles of beer and 17 bottles of whiskey were recovered from an apartment, a police spokesperson said. The arrested foreigners failed to produce valid documents for their stay in India, another official said.

379.title: Petition in Sri Lanka SC seeking travel ban on Rajapaksas, others
379.article_body: A petition has been filed in Sri Lanka's SC seeking an interim order restraining ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa, ex-Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa and other former ministers from travelling abroad without prior approval of the apex court. The petition was filed after Basil Rajapaksa was stopped from leaving at the Colombo airport. Notably, the whereabouts of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is not known.

380.title: Cong appoints Raj, Chhattisgarh CMs as observers for Guj & HP polls
380.article_body: Congress on Tuesday appointed Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel as senior observers for the upcoming Assembly elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. TS Singh Deo and Milind Deora have been appointed observers for the Gujarat polls, while Sachin Pilot and Partap Singh Bajwa will be observers for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, a party statement said.

381.title: Naga Chaitanya is very pure, honest and that inspires me: Krithi Shetty
381.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Naga Chaitanya in Venkat Prabhu's next, actress Krithi Shetty said, "I'm extremely excited to work with him because now that we have already worked together and I know how chill it is to work with him." "I have seen Chaitanya...he is really very soft, pure, honest and kind, and that inspires me," she added.

382.title: MNS chief postpones rally with party workers amid heavy rains in Maha
382.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has postponed his rally with MNS workers which was scheduled for July 13, due to heavy rains in various parts of Maharashtra. He informed workers that he will soon announce the next date of his rally. He also asked party workers to reach out to the people affected due to heavy rains.

383.title: No shortage of funds for undertaking relief & rescue works: K'taka CM
383.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said there is no shortage of funds for undertaking rescue and relief operations when many parts of the state are reeling under floods. Bommai said ₹730 crore is available with the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF). "I too am visiting the affected areas...and will issue necessary instructions for rescue and relief works," Bommai added.

384.title: Russia fines Apple $33,900 for alleged data storage violation: Report
384.article_body: A court in Russia fined Apple 2 million roubles ($33,900) on Tuesday for allegedly refusing to store the data of Russian citizens on Russian territory, the news agency Interfax reported. Previously, the US tech giant was fined by the Netherlands several times for failing to comply with an order to provide non-Apple payment methods for dating apps.

385.title: Cut GST on substitutes to banned single-use plastic items: Minister
385.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai wrote to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday, demanding a reduction in the GST rates on the substitutes for the banned single-use plastic items. "This will reduce, to some extent, the challenges being faced by the users and the manufacturers," Rai wrote in the letter.

386.title: Retail inflation eases marginally to 7.01% in June
386.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 7.01% in the month of June. It stood at 7.04% in May. This comes amid easing crude and edible oil prices. Further, India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 19.6% in May.

387.title: Varun, Janhvi visit Auschwitz Camp in Poland to prep for 'Bawaal'
387.article_body: Actors Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor visited the Auschwitz Camp in Poland as part of their preparation for Nitesh Tiwari directorial 'Bawaal'. Auschwitz was the largest concentration camp under Nazi Germany's rule. The actors visited like tourists and heard the history of World War 2 in a pre-recorded tape. The film is reportedly in the last stage of shooting.

388.title: Wow! Great moment: Nadal reacts to Djokovic's post from Wimbledon court
388.article_body: Rafael Nadal has congratulated Novak Djokovic for winning his seventh Wimbledon title. Djokovic had posted a video on Instagram, wherein his children can be seen running on the Wimbledon court. Nadal commented on the post, saying, "Wow! Great moment. Enjoy it and many congrats!" Nadal had pulled out of the tournament before the semifinal due to an abdominal injury.

389.title: Peace, stability shouldn't be disturbed in Darjeeling: Mamata Banerjee
389.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called for peace and stability in Darjeeling. She was speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the elected members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration (GTA), where elections were held after a gap of 10 years. "If few leaders try to instigate violence, don't allow them to do so," Mamata Banerjee said.

390.title: Delhi Police arrest man tasked with killing rival gang's members
390.article_body: The Delhi Police's Crime Branch on Tuesday claimed to have averted a possible gang war with the arrest of a man who was allegedly directed to eliminate gangster Neeraj Bawania and his gang members. The accused was also involved in the 2017 killing of gangster Kala Aasodiya, the uncle of Bawania while being produced in a Jhajjar court.

391.title: 4 killed, 11 injured in 2 separate road accidents in Odisha
391.article_body: Four people were killed and 11 got injured in two separate road accidents in Odisha's Subarnapur and Khordha districts. In the first accident in Subarnapur, a car rammed into a parked autorickshaw and a motorbike leading to the death of three people. In another accident, one person was killed after a truck collided with a passenger bus, police said.

392.title: Shiv Sena will support NDA's Presidential candidate Murmu: Uddhav Thackeray
392.article_body: Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections, the party's chief Uddhav Thackeray announced on Tuesday. This came after Sena MP and spokesperson Sanjay Raut had said, "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP." He said Sena shared a "good relationship" with Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha but will not act "under pressure".

393.title: Aren't Muslims Indian natives?: Owaisi on Yogi's 'population' remark
393.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath's "population imbalance" remark. "Are Muslims not natives of India? If we see the reality, natives are only tribals and Dravidian(s)," Owaisi said. His remarks come after Yogi said population control measures shouldn't cause imbalance in population growth percentages between 'mool nivasi' (native residents) and other communities.

394.title: Chhattisgarh panchayat offers ₹1 lakh to minor girl raped by 4 men
394.article_body: A minor girl was raped by 4 men in Chhattisgarh, following which the panchayat tried to bury the matter and ordered the accused to pay the survivor ₹1 lakh, police said on Tuesday. The accused intercepted the 16-year-old, who was returning from a wedding and took her to a nearby forest and raped her, Jashpur ASP Pratibha Pandey said.

395.title: Ukraine claims long-range rocket strike on Russian-held territory
395.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it had carried out a long-range rocket strike against Russian forces in Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine said that 52 Russians were killed in the attack, but a Russian-installed official in Kherson put the death toll at seven. This comes as Ukraine plans to retake its occupied regions in a counter-offensive.

396.title: Time to look beyond Shardul, Vihari, Gill: Ghavri on India's Test team
396.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Karsan Ghavri said it's time to look beyond Hanuma Vihari, Shardul Thakur and Shubman Gill in India's Test side. "Sarfaraz Khan and Suryakumar Yadav need to be drafted into the Test team as soon as possible. They're the future stars of Indian cricket," he added. India last played a Test, the rescheduled fifth Test against England, in Birmingham.

397.title: Seven injured including school children after bus hits 4 vehicles in Kolkata
397.article_body: Seven people were injured including four school children after a bus hit four separate vehicles in south Kolkata's Bakultala area. The bus hit an autorickshaw from behind and two others at around 8 am, police said. The local mob vandalised the bus and alleged that the bus driver was drunk and was driving quite recklessly, police added.

398.title: SpiceJet Dubai-Madurai flight nose wheel malfunctions, airline's 9th glitch in 24 days
398.article_body: A Dubai-Madurai SpiceJet flight was delayed on Monday after the plane's nose wheel malfunctioned at the last minute, DGCA officials said as per PTI. Confirming the issue, the airline said it sent an "alternate aircraft" to bring passengers back to India. This is reportedly the ninth technical fault that a SpiceJet flight has faced in 24 days.

399.title: Jaishankar's visit to Kerala aimed at 2024 LS polls: Vijayan
399.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's three-day visit to the state is aimed at the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "It was heard that...responsibility to ensure BJP's victory in...Lok Sabha seat was entrusted to Jaishankar," Vijayan said. "When...a [foreign] minister [goes] to inspect the flyover at Kazhakuttom, the people can...[see] real intention behind it," he added.

400.title: Biden will push for more oil output on Middle East visit: US NSA
400.article_body: President Joe Biden will urge leaders of OPEC nations to increase oil production when he meets them in Saudi Arabia this week, US NSA Jake Sullivan said on Monday. Biden will depart on Tuesday night for his first trip to the Middle East as president. Besides Saudi Arabia, Biden will visit Israel and the West Bank during his trip.
